ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Raise your palms to calm the boar.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Narrator
ScaredBoar.text: *The boar grunts and eyes you warily with its beady eyes.*

ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Beckon at the boar silently. Try to lure it closer.
CinematicNodeContext: The player beckons at the boar to lure it closer
ScaredBoar.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player beckons at the boar to lure it closer

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.
session_synopses.ScaredBoar: The player comes across a boar who's been panicked by the noise and confusion of nearby flying vessel crash. A speak with animals dialogue where the player can speak directly, or an animal handling moment where the player gains insight into the animal's temperament.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Orient yourself - where did you land?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chaos of the crash site confuses the landscape. You'll need to find a settlement or landmark.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances around general surrounds.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *And you'll need to do it quickly.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Concerned expression

session_synopses: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat.text: Better stay back. One strike could be lethal.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat: Start of a player's turn. The first time this player (and nearby players, if any) are in combat with Intellect Devourers. Intellect Devourers are lethal at close range. Keep in mind player might be alone.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeWoundedDevourers: You meet with some Intellect Devourers: walking brains essentially that are nasty creatures. They attack you. As non-gith you have no idea what these things are. As gith, you know very well.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your skull throbs, your muscles ache. Memories of the last day swim through your head before taking form.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'Zel solo scene, custom cameras may be required.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Brush off the pain - there is no time to waste.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pain deepens as you take in the world around you.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Whatever this place, you know Vlaakith's protocol: you must locate a githyanki crèche.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It is only a matter of days before tentacles split your lips, and your skin turns to gore.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At a crèche, you will find your kin. The tadpole will be removed, and you will be purified.*

session_synopses: Laezel wakes up and reflects on what she needs to do after the crash. Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht: VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a merchant, who was kidnapped by the mindflayers and died in the crash. The player can offer to help bury the body or perform any last rites, but they'll be rebuked by the spirit.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.text: And yet another. Hardly the warmest of welcomes.

session_synopses.VB_Trap: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.text: What, you got it open, just like that...?
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous/exasperated: she's just witnessed someone easily open a door that she's been trying to break down the last while.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.text: Lucky those bandits valued their own hides over their loot.

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.text: How the hells did that happen?!
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: seeing a companion crushed by a boulder - he thinks it was an accident but is unnerved

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart: The player lockpicked the crypt door that shadowheart was trying to bash.
session_synopses.VB_BanditsLeaveReaction: The player comments on how they talked the bandits into leaving (or companions react to the player's successful persuasion).
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees one of his friends crushed (dead) by a boulder and doesn't have a great deal of sympathy
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Player
AD_OutsideStatue.text: Text is too faded. Doesn't tell me who was worshipped here.
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Players with religious classes comment on the plaque.

PAD_RichSarcophagus.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RichSarcophagus.text: *Here lies the Guardian of Tombs. Through knowledge comes atonement.*
PAD_RichSarcophagus.context: NodeContext: Reading the inscription on a sarcophagus.

AD_SqueletonRoom.speaker: Player
AD_SqueletonRoom.text: I've never seen this language before. Who was worshipped here?
AD_SqueletonRoom.context: NodeContext: Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh. Reading a plaque in a slightly mocking tone before adding some displeased commentary.

session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.PAD_RichSarcophagus: Player reads the inscription on a plaque in an abandoned chapel dedicated to the god Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_SqueletonRoom: The player reads a bronze plaque at the feet of a mysterious statue

PAD_Door.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Door.text: Won't get that open easily. Maybe there's another entrance.

session_synopses.PAD_Door: Shadowheart comments as a companion on another character trying to open the exterior door to Jergal's crypt.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *Several spiders rest in the rear of the crevice.*
Crevice.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks into the crevice. There are spiders there.

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Reach in to crush the spiders.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *The infuriated spiders pour in all directions like sand. The swarm is coming.*
Crevice.context: InternalNodeContext: Focus on player's horror rather than spiders

session_synopses.Crevice: The player peeks into a crevice to see a coin pouch covered in small spiders.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

JergalWandering.speaker: Player
JergalWandering.text: You better not follow me. There would be consequences.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I had no intention of following thee. We will find one another regardless.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: Inevitability is a wheel that turns of its own accord.

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: What're Gimblebock and the others doing up there?
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.context: NodeContext: Wondering out loud - something's amiss.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Maybe we should go take a look.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Not a chance - could be a trap. Just keep your eyes peeled.

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.JergalWandering: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSpotting: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: Shoot the trap down. We must kill it before it harms someone.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: You're right. No one's safe if that thing goes loose.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: Lower the trap and ready yourself.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied1: Nymessa reacts to the death of Damayhs at Teifling scene
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.TieflingsSceneFallback: Edge-case: the normal dialog failed to start. Someone is silenced or wild shaped... Let's just do the midmeld and start combatYou come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).

session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

Cyanide.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide.text: Don't worry about him on the table. I'm not in the habit of killing drow.
Cyanide.context: NodeContext: gesturing to dead drow on the table

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then you bring Kagha back from the brink. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait patiently.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did you see another drow?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: That's neither here nor there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Look, you obviously want something. What is it?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. Now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Just be glad my bedside manner's better than yours.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come here. Let's have a look at you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine themNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine them

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Right. Yes, I'm... very tired indeed.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Then get some rest. There's no better magic.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with care

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Take a nip of whiskey before bed if you need to. Come back to me if that doesn't do it.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: I have to find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie
AD_Studying.text: I'll see if there's anything in Master Halsin's notes.

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie
AD_Studying.text: He didn't find a cure, but maybe we can make you comfortable.

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: And? Will you swear you'd die before you turn?
LockedUp.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't have the wyvern poison in her inventory, player pickpocketed it already

LockedUp.speaker: Player
LockedUp.text: Fine, just give it to me.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.Cyanide: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.AD_Studying: After poisoning the tadpoled player, Nettie settles down at her old Master's desk to see if she can uncover any secrets about the tadpole in his research.
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: I told them to run, the idiots.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better turn north here, or you'll end up like them.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

session_synopses.RaidAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades she left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingCorpses: After encountering some dead adventurers in the forest, Aradin urges his remaining company to keep moving (only plays if he's not alone).
session_synopses.AD_AradinAndRemira: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerCleaningWound: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

AD_ChaseAwayBoar.speaker: Apikusis
AD_ChaseAwayBoar.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be kind, but she's annoyed

session_synopses.005: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.
session_synopses.AD_ChaseAwayBoar: |This AD plays when Tusk, a boar, interrupts a druid while she's participating in a long, intense ritual. Tusk is getting in the way.|

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Suit yourself, but the only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down your food. You're annoyed but hiding it with indifference.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: If a gnoll catches your scent, you'll need every bit of strength. Trust me.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried about her son but hiding it behind a gruff and sharp tone.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He knows it's just because she's worried and is trying not to sound exasperated.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Sounding more worried and concerned.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Gently trying to reassure her without sounding annoyed.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Terrified for her son but trying to hide it.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.NodeContext: Mumbled - he's still half asleep and doesn't want to wake up. Can be said with a yawn, and have a snore after it.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear.text: Could you move just a little bit? I need to use the elevator.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up and moves.NodeContext: long groan, then she agrees to move - she's still very sleepy.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4.text: Sounds like you've crossed paths with Aradin before.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Yeah, when he ran off with the druid that saved our hides the first time.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Without Halsin... this grove's not so friendly, I'll tell you that.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

AD_Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
AD_Refugee1.text: Is that everything? I think that's everything...

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: I fought for your people at the gate. Show some gratitude.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: You did not fight to aid us. You simply craved the taste of blood.

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.text: *Here lies Aradin. He yearned for glory and adventure. And he got it.*
VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.context: NodeContext: Warning the player to get back.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: I chipped it on the evil thing. It was horrible.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Wait - you're big. You can get rid of the evil thing!

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Follow me. But be ready for anything.
Rat.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'anything' - he's warning the player it could get dicy

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: How do you drow do that - find pleasure in killing? I got a goblin myself, yesterday. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: I find no pleasure in killing, only regret.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: So even someone like you... feels like this? This is how it is? And it's just going to keep happening...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: Instead of giving Rikka strength, what the player told her is pulling her further into herself.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

AD_TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8.text: Should be safe to travel now.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Look around cautiously, then dig with your hands.
CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.
GraveDig.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3_8: This occurs between Okta and Ikaron. Okta is the grumpy chef in the camp and Ikaron is her son, a surly but caring guard. The purpose of these is to highlight their relationship, and how both of them care deeply for the camp, even if they're not the best at expressing it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.TieflingGuard8: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee1: Preparing to go to Baldur's Gate, wondering what to bring.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader: This is the grave of Aradin, the adventurer leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard8: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.
session_synopses.GraveDig: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.
session_synopses.AD_GruntingKid: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge.text: Arka, wait! You can't just shoot her!

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge.text: Why not? That's what her kind did to Kanon.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Ain't sure why ya protected me. Don't care, neither.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: The Absolute? Can't say I know your god.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: You've caught my interest. Have any holy literature on you?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: My tribe can tell you everythin' there is to know. Absolute blessed one of our own - Priestess Gut.
Caged.context: NodeContext: Very arrogant - extremely pleased that a goblin has been chosen to be blessed

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Got a whole lab set up. Cooks up potions that fix our lads no matter how much of a beatin' they take.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Could probably stick yer head back on if someone woz to chop it off. Mighty booyahg.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Memnos
GuardsIdle.text: Please, leave us be. This isn't a good time -

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.text: Let's hit the road, Memnos. I'm sick of this place.
GuardsIdle.context: NodeContext: Bad memories in this plac

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: I feel bad for ya. I do, really.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader.text: You'll eat those words soon enough.

session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.GuardsAvenge: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.GuardsIdle: Arka and Memnos are idle in the druid grove after going to confront the captive goblin Sazza. The goblin may or may not have been killed in this prior scene. Arka remains bitter over the recent death of their friend, Kagha, while Memnos, if present, tries to shake her out of it.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Conversation between Zevlor and Sazza that the player can overhear. The idea is that the player will understand there's something weird going on with Zevlor, that he isn't all he seems, without giving away the whole shebang.
session_synopses.Transit: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

AD_BirdStealReaction.speaker: Topaz
AD_BirdStealReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Custom crime reaction exclusive to the blue jay in this booster

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?
002.context: NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

002.speaker: Player
002.text: I just wanted to give you my smell. I'll leave you be.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: No - wait. You smell fresh. Safe. You can stay. If you must.
002.context: NodeContext: He's relazed, and wants the player to stay, though he doesn't want to admit it.

session_synopses.AD_BirdStealReaction: AD of blue jay reacting to you stealing from its nest.
session_synopses.002: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: What will we do for work when we get to the city?

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: I think I'd make a fine teacher. Or a baker. Or a butcher.

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Surprise she'd say she wants to be a butcher

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Bex has just said something strange, he's pretending to kind of ignore it.

session_synopses.AD_Shared: The two young lovers are enthusiastically making plans for when they arrive in Baldur's Gate.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: How could I be so weak?

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: Dearest Rath. You deserved so much better.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

AD_OpposedPacified.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified.text: So much death. So little justice.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: We're grateful for your efforts - though none more than the refugees.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve of this.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: He's... he's really gone, then. That means...

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Treefather, make us tall as the ash and stout as the spruce. I...

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Oh, hells - the prayer can wait. I'm... I'm going to miss him.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.AD_LeaderPersuaded: Plays ONLY if Rath died in the combat against the Shadow Druids! If Rath is alive, He and Kagha have an AD together instead. In all cases, Kagha is mourning, shocked and repentant at what she has done.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedPacified: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together
session_synopses.LeaderPostGoblins: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.text: You're curious - you've got a great many odours about you. What happened to you?
Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear sits back to listen to you.

Bear.speaker: Player
Bear.text: That's a complicated story. I doubt you'd understand.

session_synopses.Bear: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Eramas
AD_ZorruGuard.context: NodeContext: Finding his colleague tiresome for even asking

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: Just wait 'til you see 'em. Yellow all over. Covered in spots. No noses to speak of.

AD_TieflingKid004.speaker: Zaki
AD_TieflingKid004.text: You're one of those toad-people Zorru saw!

session_synopses.AD_ZorruGuard: Zorru and another tiefling speak. Zorru mentions the gith are after him - Tilses isn't sure they even exist.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingKid004: Tiefling kid recognises Lae'zel as a githyanki via AD

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: He didn't come back, did he? His smell is gone. He's gone...
Bear.context: NodeContext: Detecting the bear's panick and concern.

Bear.speaker: Player
Bear.text: You're the saddest bear I've ever seen. This is depressing.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.context: NodeContext: The player just told him watching him is depressing.

session_synopses.Bear: The bear is worried and depressed because Halsin hasn't come back yet.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: It is quite a racket. You could just spare your ears by leaving.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: We can't! Our brains are melting!

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Corinna, drag me away! The big one is right - we should go, before it's too late.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: With my last strength, I will save us both! Away. Away.
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: played dramatics

session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: |Cinematic: The woman cradled a carved wooden box, from which a soft melody chimed.|
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That's a pleasant tune.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Oh, try listening to it a hundred times a day.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Weary, remembering how much she had to listen to the song.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: My husband made it to keep our little monster quiet - traded one headache for another, really.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Laughing at their naivety

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why do you want to sell it?

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I... don't have anything else. My husband was carrying our packs when the gnolls found us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little lost. Remembering something painful.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: My daughter, sh-she thought they were just big dogs. I tried to get to her... I tried, but-
node_data.context: NodeContext: Breaking up towards end of sentence, grieving

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: You must - you must think I'm a monster.  But they say you need coin to enter the city. Bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Approaching hysteria, doesn't know what to do

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the box.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It's no masterpiece. Her gaze flicks between the box and you. You realise she's lying.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Had all of that been a lie?

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: What? How did you... no, it wasn't all a lie.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Appalled you could even say this, but gives up mock-defiance midway through

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I do need the coin. The guards in Baldur's Gate aren't going to let us in without a little encouragement.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She sighs and her persona changes completely. We've caught on to her scam and she's impatient with us to move on so she can try again.NodeContext: Complete change - more confident, more mocking of us.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Same way you weren't going to stop and listen without a sob story.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking - not interested in your accusations.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You must be in dire need to lie like that. Here. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ...seriously? I'll take any fool's coin. Call it charity if it makes you feel better about it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Incredulous.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: That's worth a tip, I suppose - if you're looking for the real swindlers here, keep an eye on the children.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Scorning, spiteful - not giving you the victory.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: That lot could give the Thieves' Guild a run for their money.

session_synopses: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)
