VB_ReturnedToGrove.speaker: Player
VB_ReturnedToGrove.text: I was a slave when we were last here. I do not appreciate being reminded of that.

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

AD_Grumpy.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy.text: Where do druids keep their liquor?
AD_Grumpy.context: NodeContext: irritated - just raided a grove and there's not a lot of good loot

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon.text: We'll make it last. We always do.

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon.text: I can't thin the broth much more than this.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Nearly. We've ransacked the packs for anything that'll burn.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Good. Reckon we can brave a few nights without lamp-light if it means burning these buggers.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: We did it. Come on, give me a kiss.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Hold still! I'll kiss you when you've stopped bleeding, you lummox.
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: Concentrating on seeing to his wounds. Gentle admonishment

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Yes, you are. Now stop squirming!
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: 'I love you and share in your happiness but you're being pain in the arse right now'

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Can we just get this done, please? I want to get below before -
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Fed up. Hands are covered in a layer of oil

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Before what? Afraid you might actually have to fight?
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: False bravado, savage - he wants to seem like he can't wait to fight.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Look. Asharak already picked who he wanted on the walls, right? And it wasn't us.
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Knows he's full of crap, but too tired to take him up on it.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: You might be afraid of your own shadow, but some of us -
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Prickly - his courage has been questioned

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Puff out your chest all you like - I'm going where it's safe.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Look at this place. Like a pen of hogs waiting for the butcher's knife. We need to act!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Quiet! Some of the children might hear you.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Oh, perish the thought they overhear a little honesty once in their short lives -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Another word and it won't be the goblins you have to worry about!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: That's to say me at the front while the others stay back and do as I say?

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Shut it just for once, you insufferable, oafish -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio.text: Stop it! Listen to someone else for once.
ProdigyTrio.context: NodeContext: Exasperated - gesturing to the player to continue.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio.text: Rolan front and centre - you two don't want to get caught in his crossfire.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: There you go, Rolan - the glory of dying first is all yours. Happy?

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Exceedingly happy. But I won't be dying.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio.text: That's as close to an agreement as we're likely to get. Let's keep it that way.

AD_LookingForDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni.text: Doni! I don't want to lock you outside, please.
AD_LookingForDoni.context: NodeContext: More quietly than her other shouts, as much to herself.

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.text: Good work - the True Souls are proper pleased.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: Admiring my beautiful barricades? Might not be pretty, but they'll stop a charging worg.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can leave your valuables with me if you like.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: Goblins strip the dead down to the last stitch, so I hear.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Knowingly, trying to freak player out

RobberKid.speaker: Player
RobberKid.text: No one's going to die today. I promise.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: He sighs, as if the player is being unreasonable.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: All but saying the player's going to die.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: Can you two help? Anything you don't pack is getting left behind.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Meli
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: We can always get more stuff later.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: You won't get there if we starve on the way. Gonna rob your friends when you're hungry?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: I pray next time I square up to a goblin, you're there again.

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Goblin kids would 'ave put up a better fight.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious - describing a child who tried to fight back during an attack

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Killed my first human when I was five years old. Tieflings are soft.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious glee - talking about killing a tiefling child

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.text: I wish I could help on the walls, but... I wasn't a soldier, really. Just a trumped-up guard.

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.context: NodeContext: He gives up on trying to come up with an excuse - frightened and apologetic.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: ... and over the horizon they saw a ship, like some great beast bursting from the waves.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: The Wandering Eye, the jewel of Balduran's fleet! So named because -
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Moment of a story where hero returns

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: - well... because Balduran travelled far and... saw much.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, realizing children might not understand concept of Wandering Eyes

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: But he had finally come home to save the city he loved!

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: He drove the raiders away and raised a wall to protect his people.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Happy ending, reassuring them that evil was defeated

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: And so they named the city to honour him. Balduran's - Baldur's Gate.

Drow.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow.text: A glorious day. The Absolute will be pleased.

Drow.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow.text: But there is more to be done. This place is home to druids - root them out and kill them.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
BackupLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.text: Some dumb fairy tale is all we have left...

Sapper_004.speaker: Sapper Gald
Sapper_004.context: NodeContext: smug - just massacred some tieflings

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: I'm not singing your praises. You and the tieflings brought violence to this place.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: Coolly. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: It wasn't our fight. You dragged us into it.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: She's accusing the player, pointing at them. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Narrator
GrieflingFriend.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: What is it? I'm... I'm busy.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend.text: Mind if I join you in prayer?

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: I do mind. This isn't exactly my bravest moment; I'd rather suffer it alone.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? To spill blood in this sacred place?
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: It would have been easier if you just died, Kagha. Now I have to hear your excuses instead.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I owe you nothing. Goblins swarmed us like roaches while you stumbled after the past.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You chose to abandon us. I chose to protect us!

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Silence. The rite has been ended.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Forceful. He's heard enough from her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I will allow you to stay. But consider yourself a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids - our place in the natural order.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You shall learn it all once again, right here. Backslide, and nature's fury will crush you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from HalsinNodeContext: Not happy. Said through clenched teeth. She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from Halsin

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You were too lenient. There's bad blood between tieflings and druids because of her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Spilled blood will not right bad blood. Allow me to deal with my own - I still have need of her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: Mattis says we should say thank you.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: Shy, not understanding that they almost died

RaidersArriveBeforeFight.text: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara steps up on the stone tower outside the gate to the Druid Grove, she assumes her imposing posture, arms at her back, she locks gaze with the player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara steps up on the stone tower outside the gate to the Druid Grove, she assumes her imposing posture, arms at her back, she locks gaze with the player

RaidersArriveBeforeFight.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight.text: This is it. Everything turns on this.
CinematicNodeContext: ~The archer nocks another arrow, when the army arrives beneath Minthara and lowers the bow to watch
RaidersArriveBeforeFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The archer nocks another arrow, when the army arrives beneath Minthara and lowers the bow to watch

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Yeah. It's all... green. Why do druids store tree muck inside?

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Dunno. But some of it's gotta be valuable, right?
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: Eager, hoping to make a profit

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Maybe. Can't tell if it's for eating or smoking though.
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: A bit put out. Not sure if this raid is worth his time.

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: *Ah-choo!* Ugh... smells funny whatever it's for. Grab as much as you can.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: Where do druids store their liquor?

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: I'm not even sure they drink liquor.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: incredulous - responding to a question about where druids store liquor, heavy emphasis on 'drink'

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: If they do it's probably made of grapes or apples, or some other rubbish.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: complaining about the alcohol druids probably enjoy

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: What's taking you two so long? Get the goods and get moving!
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Preemptively annoyed with his subordinates - they're not very smart.

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Gurd keeps sneezing and dropping stuff.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Respectfully talking to his boss - and getting his friend in trouble

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Shut your mouth! I... *Ah-choo!* Feckin' leaves.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Gurd is allergic to the herbs in the storehouse he looted and keeps sneezing

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: You serious? Stuff something in yer nose and hurry up.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Someone decided we were the best suited to see to any wounded.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Bemused, out of her depth.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Better all 'round if you keep everyone in one piece up there. Trust me.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Making a joke of it, but an edge of really urging to you protect everyone

LairDoor.speaker: Doni
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans down to show Doni, Player and the DoorNodeContext: Worried grunt as he greets the player - trying to communicate a hopeless situation

LairDoor.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor.text: Go away! There's nothing in here for you - for any of you.
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSInternalNodeContext: This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.NodeContext: Urgent, a little frightened even. This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.

AD_CoweringRefugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_CoweringRefugee004.context: NodeContext: Terrified, begging for his life as goblins close in.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: The goblins... do they fight well?

Tiefling005.speaker: Player
Tiefling005.text: Well enough. But you have what they don't - something to fight for.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: Some of us have more of that than others. I'll just be glad to live out the day.

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Narrator
RaidersArriveAfterFight.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind, drowning out the goblins' battle cries.*
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sound of goblins can be heard from the forest. The drow-led raiding party emerges from the forest and arrive outside the gatesNodeContext: describing an uncomfortable feeling as a drow prepares to speak with us telepathically

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaidersArriveAfterFight.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
RaidersArriveAfterFight.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaiderArrogant.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
RaiderArrogant.text: They'll be worg meat soon enough!

Pet004.speaker: Tusk
Pet004.text: Don't you smell it? The monsters are gone, and the air is fresh with new beginnings.
Pet004.context: NodeContext: Pleased and full of hope for the future.

DruidGuard003.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003.text: Some normalcy can return to the Grove. At last.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Yes...? I'm pretty certain if I stop for too long they will actually eat me.
Bard.context: NodeContext: A whispered aside - she's worried about losing the childrens' already fading attention

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why don't you play some music instead?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I only seem to know the sad ones, and, well...

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Now's a time for cheerful lies, as my master would say.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: We're free of the goblins, but the grove is changed. Wounded.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: The days ahead won't be easy, but we'll manage. We have to.

AD_BickeringTrainees.speaker: Ide
AD_BickeringTrainees.text: You can't even count to a hundred.

AD_BickeringTrainees.speaker: Gan
AD_BickeringTrainees.text: I don't have to count. I just have to hit 'em.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave.text: Rest well, Arka. I'm sure Kanon's waiting for you.

Refugee004.speaker: Toron
Refugee004.text: Thought you'd left us to our fate, running off like you did. Glad I was wrong.

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: He's back! You brought Halsin back!

AD_Refugees.speaker: Danis
AD_Refugees.text: Would you... like to pray, or something?

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: First druids, now goblins. Lady Doom really has it out for us, doesn't she?

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: I can't wait to go. This place is boring.

Sapper_002.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: with a cruel smile

Sapper_002.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002.text: ... when I hit 'em with this stuff, it'll barely leave a stain.
Sapper_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: referring to the explosives he's carrying

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: You. Liam said you sprung him from the goblin camp.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: And now you're back to stand with this lot. A right soft heart you've got, don't you?

Adventurer2.speaker: Player
Adventurer2.text: I could say the same for you.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Soft head, more like. If I were smart, I'd be back in Baldur's Gate with my feet up.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: But this crowd patched Liam up when they had plenty reason not to. Might be I misjudged 'em.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Still a lost cause, mind - but if you can't live smart, you may as well die right.

RitualDruid003.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid003.text: I'm tempted to leave with the rest of you... but I can't abandon my home.
RitualDruid003.context: NodeContext: Players are going on a quest that takes them from the grove. Inwe is tempted to leave the drama in the grove behind.

AD_CheckingBarricade.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade.text: Well. We won't be long finding out, I suppose.
AD_CheckingBarricade.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, fatalistic - making a joke of it

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
AD_StupidAndDummy.context: NodeContext: shouting at a wooden training dummy that he's attacking

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy.text: It ain't got eyes, you muck-skull. It ain't even alive!
AD_StupidAndDummy.context: NodeContext: exasperated - talking to a friend who is attacking a wooden training dummy

AD_StupidAndDummy.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy.text: Stop messin' about and get back to work!

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders.text: Hands off, Mattis! I earned this!

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders.text: Well, I'm stealin' on my own when we get to Baldur's Gate.

AD_PackingTraders.speaker: Mattis
AD_PackingTraders.text: Fine by me. I bet there's plenty of adults with loose pockets there.

Servant005.speaker: Arron
Servant005.text: By the trees! I don't know what I dreaded more - the goblins, or being stuck here with Kagha for the rest of my days.
Servant005.context: NodeContext: 'By the trees' is an exclamation mark, not him saying literally 'by the trees over there.'

Servant005.speaker: Arron
Servant005.text: But you've solved both those problems in one go.

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: The Harpy Killer! Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid.speaker: Player
HarpyKid.text: You're not worth the trouble, kid. You're on your own.

HarpyKid.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid.text: But... didn't you kill those goblins at the gate? You can win. I know you can!

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.text: Even if goblins get in, they can't find us here. Mum said.
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

Pet003.speaker: Topaz
Pet003.text: Ahh, my nest is still whole! Those monsters didn't touch it.
Pet003.context: NodeContext: Relieved - there was a big fight, and he thought the nest he worked so hard on got destroyed.

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Narrator
MindMeldAfterCombat.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: describing the sensation of a drow telepathically communicating with us

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

MindMeldAfterCombat.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
MindMeldAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: Glad you're here with us. A bunch of ratty goblins aren't gonna send us running. We've been surviving long enough. Time to start living.

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: I nearly dispatched those goblins myself, but it seems you managed well enough.
Prodigy.context: NodeContext: Idle arrogance, as if he could have taken out an entire camp of enemies if it weren't beneath him

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: And why wield a masterwork where a butcher's blade will do? My thanks, truly.
Prodigy.context: NodeContext: Airy condescension - you saved him a menial task, but it was perfecly suited to you.

Mule2.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2.text: If you are afraid, hide beneath my legs - like a good calf. I will stop them.
Mule2.context: NodeContext: Determined - ready for a fight.

AD_CoweringRefugee003.speaker: Bex
AD_CoweringRefugee003.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her lover to run as goblins close in around them.

AD_CoweringRefugee002.speaker: Danis
AD_CoweringRefugee002.text: Oh gods, oh gods, oh gods -
AD_CoweringRefugee002.context: NodeContext: Repeated over and over in panic - equivalent of 'ohshitohshitohshit'

Tiefling003.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003.text: Back to worrying about road rations it is. So many mouths to feed, but...

Tiefling003.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003.text: ... well, that's not a bad problem to have. Thank you, truly.

Kid004.speaker: Zaki
Kid004.text: It smells bad out here. I want to go home.

ScoutCaptive.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive.text: You're starting to feel like my personal bodyguard. I wish you were.
ScoutCaptive.context: NodeContext: with a smile of genuine gratitude

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: Stay safe out there, you hear?

AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.text: You backstabbing birna mrag! We trusted you!
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.context: NodeContext: Angry and accusatory, pre-combat. Birna mrag meaning 'piece of shit' in the infernal language. Pronounced 'BIRna mRAG'

WarchiefGrumpy.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy.text: Oi. Have you lot really got black, boilin' blood? Freaks.
WarchiefGrumpy.context: NodeContext: excited, practically rubbing his hands. on tiefling variant, ending with 'freaks', dismissive and insulting to player

AD_GrieflingOnGate.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate.text: All this bloody waiting. I'll go find those goblins myself if they don't appear soon.
AD_GrieflingOnGate.context: NodeContext: Keyed up, ready to fight

Pet002.speaker: Silver
Pet002.text: I must protect him. I must.

AD_HalsinJoinsFight.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinJoinsFight.text: You will not desecrate this grove! Not while I draw breath!
AD_HalsinJoinsFight.context: NodeContext: Outraged. Joining combat to defend his home.

Servant004.speaker: Elwyn
Servant004.text: I didn't think we'd survive the goblins. I kept imagining the screams, the blood...
Servant004.context: NodeContext: She let fear get the better of her, and she's ashamed.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: What's this? Mattis, this is junk! Waste of effort hauling it with us.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mattis
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: No, there's collectors in the city! They'll pay good coin for it, I swear!

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.text: Fine, but you're carrying it yourself.

TorturedAdventurer.speaker: Narrator
TorturedAdventurer.text: *Despite the chaos in the camp, the adventurer sleeps soundly, wounds expertly bandaged.*

RitualDruid002.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002.text: After everything that's happened, you still fought beside us.
RitualDruid002.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

RitualDruid002.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002.text: I don't know if we deserved your help, but I'm glad we got it.
RitualDruid002.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies.text: My powers are being wasted back here! I could repel any attack in the blink of an eye.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies.text: Or wipe us out in the blink of an eye. Best you stay right here.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies.text: Ridiculous. Someone of my skill should choose their own vantage point.

AD_Prodigies.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies.text: She just means you're our last hope, Rolan. We, eh, may need you to save the day.

Sapper_003.speaker: Sapper Dextor
Sapper_003.text: Don't be nickin' the best loot for yerself.
Sapper_003.context: NodeContext: they just massacred their enemies - he's being cheeky rather than hostile

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: Torm spare me, that thing looks fearsome.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade.text: Depends which side of it you're standing on, I suppose.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: Watching gods, but you're a prettier sight than any I expected to see today.
Trainer.context: NodeContext: He's relieved to see you, but warning of the impending attack - player might just have jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I'd given you up for dead at the goblin camp - and our hopes along with you.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: What happened?! We've spotted goblins massing in the woods.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: Their drow commander found the grove - and she means to take it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: ...A drow. Right - I'd say I'm surprised, but Beshaba's had her mark on us since Elturel.
Trainer.context: NodeContext: You've just told him he's facing insurmountable odds, and he's reacting with fear but resigned pragmatism. His outlook tends to be of the 'Murphy's Law' variety

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: You don't owe us any apologies - but I'll take your help, if you're offering.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: No, you don't get it. I'm with them.

Trainer.speaker: Wyll
Trainer.text: No - you can't! I trusted you!
Trainer.context: NodeContext: Upset, the player has given up the entire tiefling grove for slaughter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Just shout if you need help up there.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Confident, takes self very seriously

RaiderBossy.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderBossy.text: I see a lot o' red blades around; the Absolute'll be chuffed.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: Halsin's cancelled the rite. The brood is exposed. And we've you to thank, Silvanus have pity.
DruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic "and we've YOU to thank"

PAD_DeadKids.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadKids.text: Butchered. They didn't stand a chance.
PAD_DeadKids.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart - her actions led to these childrens' deaths and her background as a dark priestess would suggest she'd feel triumphant, but her reaction is instead deflated and betays conflicted emotions (while not being entirely despairing). She got what she thought she wanted, but it feels hollow. / Astarion - bitterly. He's a little surprised that he's unhappy about it.

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_LootingGoblins.text: Nah. Raggedy bastards ain't got anythin' worth stealin'. 'Cept their horns.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: annoyed at lack of good loot - the 'horns' are the horns of tiefling characters these goblins just murdered

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins.text: I'll swap you six kiddy horns for that big one you carved off the old fella.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: malicious; talking about the horns of dead tieflings

AD_LootingGoblins.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins.text: Nah. Gonna use that for a flagon.
AD_LootingGoblins.context: NodeContext: brushing off his friend's barter - the thing he's talking about is a tiefling horn

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.context: NodeContext: Shouting drill sergeant style to archers along the wall.

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.text: Are you bloody mad? We nearly -
EntranceMeeting.context: NodeContext: Shouting down to player, relieved at the near miss but irritated all the same

EntranceMeeting.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting.text: Never mind. Get up here. I want that gate closed when the goblins arrive.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: I'm ready for this - I'd rather die fighting than with an arrow in my back.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Deep breath at beginning of line - pysching herself up

RaiderViolent.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderViolent.text: Geroff. These're my music boxes - find yer own.

RitualDruid001.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid001.text: None of this feels real. Not yet.
RitualDruid001.context: NodeContext: So much has happened in such a short time - infighting among the druids, her first druid disappearing, goblins attacking the grove - it's all a bit surreal.

RaiderHardy.speaker: Brawler Gurd
RaiderHardy.context: NodeContext: charging into combat or actively participating in combat. A warcry.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.NodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.

AD_WarchiefAndPotions.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.text: Oi! That stuff ain't for you!
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.context: NodeContext: sees minions drinking potions, annoyed with them

AD_WarchiefAndPotions.speaker: Booyahg Benta
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.text: We only drank one! And it churned up our guts somethin' rotten.
AD_WarchiefAndPotions.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain, trying to make excuses

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Narrator
EntranceMeetingWyll.context: CinematicNodeContext: | *The men turned towards player, hand at their swords.* |

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Give me one reason why they shouldn't slay you where you stand.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Player
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: You need all the help you can get. Now stand down before I put you down.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Fine - one last chance. See that you don't waste it.

EntranceMeetingWyll.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll.text: Inside, and hurry. I want that gate closed when the goblins get here.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Glad to see some goblin blood spilled for a change. I was sick of running from those rats.

RaiderCrafty.speaker: Warrior Trunk
RaiderCrafty.text: All these horns'll make fer good trophies... uh, no offence.
RaiderCrafty.context: NodeContext: The horns referred to are on the heads of recently slaughtered tiefling refugees, killed in a goblin raid. He's standing among the dead, pleased with the victory - his second phrase is an embarrassed acknowledgement of the fact he's talking to a tiefling ally

VoloBear.speaker: Bosk
VoloBear.text: You smell like blood. Like fighting. Be gone.
VoloBear.context: NodeContext: The bear smells the blood from the battlefield on you.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins ready themselves at the pool.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Futzing around with his pants.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping around a bit - he very much has to pee, and the sound of the waterfall is making it all the more urgent.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: He starts peeing before the others.NodeContext: Half pain and half relief. Finally, he can pee.

AD_RaidersAtPool.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool.context: CinematicNodeContext: The rest of the goblins begin to pee.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: Still here? The smart ones ran a long while back.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: You do good work. If you can handle more than goblins, might be I'll have use of you in Baldur's Gate.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: Always a deal to be done - even now.
LeaderKid.context: NodeContext: Casually referring to the impending battle.

LeaderKid.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid.text: Try not to die up there.

AD_CaringForOx.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx.text: Easy now! Not going to let the goblins get you.
AD_CaringForOx.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense - to an ox. Calming herself more than it.

AD_CaringForOx.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx.text: Unless they get me first, I suppose.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: The road to Baldur's Gate will be easy compared to that.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: Thanks - for keeping these people safe. For keeping us safe.

AD_RikkaAndDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_RikkaAndDoni.text: There you are! Thank the gods. Enjoyed your little adventure, did you?
AD_RikkaAndDoni.context: NodeContext: A child she's been worried sick looking for has returned. She's relieved but still her normal composed self. Child is non-verbal but she's speaking with him as if it's a back and forth.

AD_RikkaAndDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_RikkaAndDoni.text: Let's get you below. You can tell everyone about it, hm?
AD_RikkaAndDoni.context: NodeContext: A child she's been worried sick looking for has returned. She's wry and relieved. Child is non-verbal but she's speaking with him as if it's a back and forth.

ChefAndSon.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon.text: I can't believe they just left!
ChefAndSon.context: NodeContext: Outraged - you're furious with your kin.

ChefAndSon.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon.context: NodeContext: Stern - you know there is no point complaining. You want your son to focus on getting ready for the fight.

ChefAndSon.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon.text: No! Our so-called kin fled the moment their tails were in danger!
ChefAndSon.context: NodeContext: Angry and aghast - you would never do this to your kin. You can't believe they left you behind.

GoblinLush.speaker: Tracker Azak
GoblinLush.text: If the Absolute wants 'em dead, we'll massacre 'em!
GoblinLush.context: NodeContext: preparing for a raid - eager

Wyll.speaker: Wyll
Wyll.text: Ah - a familiar face. Didn't think I'd see you again!

Wyll.speaker: Wyll
Wyll.text: I've never been more thrilled to be wrong.

Wyll.speaker: Wyll
Wyll.text: Blow the horn - the trap has been set. Today, we write our own legends!

RaiderStupid.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
RaiderStupid.text: You'd think devil spawn would put up a better fight, wouldn't ya? It's like they didn't even wanna live.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Please - don't let the evil ones in.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Please. Have you seen Doni anywhere? Young boy, doesn't talk?

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: We need to get him into the cave before the goblins come.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: The kids found a hidden cave. We're going to hide them there.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: But we can't seal it up until we find Doni.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: This place... this place means everything to me.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I don't know if I can ever restore Silvanus' peace to this place.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking.text: What do you think of opening a cart in Baldur's Gate?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking.text: A cart? Like on the street?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking.text: Exactly. Noble types won't want a tiefling cookin' for them, but common folk...

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking.text: A cart sounds fine, but do I have to haul it around?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking.text: Until we make the coin for a proper ox, maybe.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: I still can't believe you cleared the roads. Expect I won't until the city gates swing shut behind us.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: shaken, voice breaking - has just survived an attempted massacre

AD_CoweringStargazer.speaker: Nadira
AD_CoweringStargazer.text: Blood and fire. It's the Hells all over again.
AD_CoweringStargazer.context: NodeContext: Exhausted and a bit afraid.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: We've lost people today. But we are alive, and the dead have bought us a chance.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: The greatest honour we can do them is to use it - so make yourselves ready.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: The road waits - and beyond it, Baldur's Gate.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: You. I won't pretend to know why, but you've been a friend to us when we needed it most.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's what we have.
BackupVictory.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: Gods above - that's the druid. Some timing you have, Halsin.

BackupVictory.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory.text: Go on. He'll want to speak to the one who saved his grove, I expect.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: I left my sword in the cave. Don't tell, but... I don't want to touch it again.

Trainee001.speaker: Wyll
Trainee001.text: It's all right. Don't tell anyone - but I was afraid, too.

RaiderBold.speaker: Warrior Clack
RaiderBold.context: NodeContext: Warcry - said either while rushing into battle, or in the thick of it

Sapper_001.speaker: Sapper Moke
Sapper_001.text: Back off! Got enough powder to blow us all to bits!
Sapper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrel - possibly waving the player backNodeContext: carrying an explosive barrel into combat

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: I hope you're here to fight. You look a sight tougher than the others.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: Need a weapon? I still have a few left.

RaiderCunning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
RaiderCunning.text: Hope we weren't s'posed to take any prisoners...
RaiderCunning.context: NodeContext: standing over slaughtered enemies - pleased with himself, but slightly worried they might have gone overboard in killing EVERYONE

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You imperilled the grove - how dare you even look me in the eye.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I did what I had to. A pity you don't see that.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I thought I had been a good teacher to you. Clearly not.

AD_LoversOverTortured.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured.text: Beshaba pass over, look what they did to him.

AD_LoversOverTortured.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversOverTortured.text: Aye. Goblins know a damn sight more about doing harm than I do about healing it.

AD_LoversOverTortured.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured.text: You did well, love. At least he'll wake up to some friendly faces.

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: Only the long road to Baldur's Gate to worry about now. Let's hope our luck holds out.

RaiderFunny.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
RaiderFunny.text: All this killin'... for the Absolute!
RaiderFunny.context: NodeContext: standing over corpses after a slaughter - praising his god, the Absolute

RaiderChieftain.speaker: Skrut
RaiderChieftain.text: Drow sez they've got kids in there...

RaiderChieftain.speaker: Skrut
RaiderChieftain.text: ... gonna try an' catch one. Be a nice plaything for my little 'uns.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.text: We did it. We actually did it!

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.context: NodeContext: Relief and resolve. Honouring the memory of a dead comrade.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.text: He'd be proud of you. I know he would.
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.context: NodeContext: He being the dead comrade, Kanon.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.text: We'll raise a bottle in his name, first chance we get.
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.context: NodeContext: Memnos joined in the defences, thanks to a pep talk from the players.

RaiderHefty.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty.text: Oh look, we missed a teef in all the slaughter!
RaiderHefty.context: NodeContext: Mock surprise/joy at the prospect of more killing - but he knows you're an ally, you just LOOK like the enemy.

RaiderHefty.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty.text: Just funnin', mate. We know you're one of us. Cold-blooded killer.
RaiderHefty.context: NodeContext: As if thumping you on the arm playfully, a joke between friends. Last line is said with respect - you're complicit in the slaughter of your own kind.

Servant001.speaker: 300edf9c-c71a-43db-925e-a2953a4e6203
Servant001.text: This is a holy sanctuary, not a bazaar. Please leave.

AD_PotionRaiders.speaker: Booyahg Benta
AD_PotionRaiders.text: I don't think that were a healing potion, mate. You don't look good.

Melee_001.speaker: Warrior Jawn
Melee_001.context: NodeContext: Goblin language battle cry - translates as "ATTACK!". Shouted while running into battle.  (Ke-wreck-NOR)

AD_Sappers.speaker: Sapper Moke
AD_Sappers.text: Are we gonna blow this place to bits or wot?

AD_Sappers.speaker: Sapper Dextor
AD_Sappers.text: Not unless the drow tells us to.
AD_Sappers.context: NodeContext: annoyed with the friend he's talking to - wishes he'd just shut up

AD_Sappers.speaker: Sapper Gald
AD_Sappers.text: Let's just keep out of her way. She's smiling. I get scared when she smiles.
AD_Sappers.context: NodeContext: talking about Minthara, their drow commander who just won a battle. Genuinely scared.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.text: You've actually fought goblins before, haven't you?

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.text: So have you, if I'm not mistaken.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.text: That wasn't - that's not the same. I was terrified the whole time.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.text: Hah - sounds exactly the same, then.

AD_GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriend.context: NodeContext: A prayer. Afraid of the attack to come.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: My horns for a normal day.

Refugee001.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001.text: Told you to get out while you could, didn't I?

Refugee001.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001.text: Should've taken my own bloody advice.

AD_GettingArmed.speaker: Guex
AD_GettingArmed.text: The more weapons we have on show, the less likely anyone'll give us trouble.

WarchiefBrave.speaker: Rozzak
WarchiefBrave.text: One of 'em was prayin' when I slit its throat. Who do devils even pray to?
WarchiefBrave.context: NodeContext: just finished slaughtering civilians, guards and refugees hiding in a druid grove - pondering a specific killing. Amused.

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: I wasn't sure about you at first. Thought you might be trouble. I was very wrong.

AD_CraftyAtPool.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_CraftyAtPool.text: Think we could get more beer?

AD_CharmedKidStory.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory.text: I was so scared I just hid.

AD_CharmedKidStory.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory.text: But when I looked up, the harpy was gone!

AD_CharmedKidStory.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory.text: Because that person was a monster hunter, and they killed it!

HalsinReturns.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. And again, I am in your debt.
HalsinReturns.context: NodeContext: Content and grateful. Looks around at his surrounds in general, happy to be home,

HalsinReturns.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns.text: Speak to Rath - he will reward you for your efforts.
HalsinReturns.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

HalsinReturns.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns.text: Rest. Heal. Celebrate if you wish. Mourn if you must. Come morning, we shall discuss delivering you from your parasite.
HalsinReturns.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

AD_InstructionsForKids.speaker: Rikka
AD_InstructionsForKids.text: If there's fighting, you run and you do not stop. For anything.

session_synopses.AD_Grumpy: Goblin warchief complains about the raid on the den after the victory. It was too easy - he wants more.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSon: Player eavedrops on arguments between Okta and her son Ikaron. Dialogue changes depending on whether or not the player has spoken to Ikaron about the missing tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels: Asharak is doing the rounds, speaking to tiefling civilians in the area. Sergeant rallying the troops/manning the defences kind of feel.
session_synopses.AD_LoversWithoutGuard: Bex is tending to an injured Danis after the successful defence of the druid grove. Elated to survive. Danis, a little whoozy from his injuries, decides this is a good time for a romantic gesture.
session_synopses.AD_FillingOilBarrel: Guex and Pandirna are filling oil barrels in preparation for a goblin attack. Pandirna is worried and venting, Guex is pretending he can't wait to fight.
session_synopses.ProdigyTrio: Rolan (the prodigy) bickers with his Cal and Lia. The player can choose to weigh in or not. Soldiers, rangers or fighters can give some specific advice on their battle formation.
session_synopses.AD_LookingForDoni: A worried Rikka is looking for Doni so that she can lock up a shelter before an imminent attack.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefBraveVictory: Rozzak walks around the Den after the raid, stopping to call out praise and support to nearby goblins
session_synopses.AD_ViolentAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: A tiefling on the eve of the goblin attack. She's not quite allowing the gravity of the situation to sink in, focusing instead on busywork to keep her mind off it.
session_synopses.RobberKid: Cheeky and disrespectful child - player may have previously encountered him stealing from someone.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderScolding: Mol scolds Lim and Meli and tells them to get back to packing..
session_synopses.ParentB: Marricko is hidden away as the attack appraoches. She's afraid, but determined to keep it together.If her daughter is alive, she's worried about her but also knows she can take care of herself if needs be.If her child is bad, she laments when she even survived. She is despondant and grieving.
session_synopses.RaiderMurderous: a goblin participating in a large raid - speaks maliciously about killing the youngsters at the raid target
session_synopses.Refugee002: One half of a couple the player may have spoken to previously. He's mentioned working as a guard before, but when it comes to actually fighting he's a little scared. Cheerfulness masking real fear and doubt.
session_synopses.AD_KidStory: The bard is telling a story to distract the children from the impending battle. She herself is barely holding back her own fear.
session_synopses.AD_BardDefendsKids: The bard takes a last stand to defend children from goblins who've gotten past the gate. We might have discovered her backstory - where her mentor and other travelling companions were recently slaughtered in similar fashion.
session_synopses.Drow: A drow commander leading an attack on a group of tiefling refugees. She is following the orders of a new god, the Absolute, and is zealous and sadistic. In this situation, the player has sided with her and betrayed the tieflings - a fact she enjoys a great deal.
session_synopses.BackupLeader: Cerys is a tiefling ranger who has been out scouting the road ahead for Zevlor/Asharak, trying to find a way through the goblins on the road. She returns just after the attack on the den to discover her leader is dead, and that she'll have to take his place. She seeks player out immediately and forces a dialogue..
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderSighing: Mol is muttering to herself while listening to the bard's tale in the back of the cave..
session_synopses.Sapper_004: a goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove
session_synopses.RitualDruid005: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Tahani blames the player and the tieflings for bringing a fight to their door, and she's not shy about telling them.
session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos, a tiefling, is praying/hiding while the goblins attack the Druid Grove. He admits that he's lost his nerve and doesn't want to fight off the attackers. We can try to persuade him and give him courage; if we succeed, he'll join the defences. Fail, and he'll continue cowering.
session_synopses.HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin meets with Kagha after returning to the grove. He chastises her for her actions during his absence. Depending on Kagha's demeanour, he may soften his tone or not.They disperse after this dialog.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: Child is sitting listening to a story - aware of the chaos going on around her but confident it will turn out alright because that's what her sister has told her.
session_synopses.RaidersArriveBeforeFight:
Takes place immediately after the player blows the horn at the gates of the grove, beginning an attack on the refugees hiding there. The surviving tiefling leader rallies his troops, then the drow commander arrives with her retinue of goblins. She mind-melds with the player. She expects them - as True Souls - to betray the tieflings, and players must choose whether to side with her OR with the tieflings as the attack begins.

This is a huge fight and a decisive moment for the tieflings, the drow/goblins, AND the players.
session_synopses.AD_WarehouseLooters: Two goblin raiders are looting the Grove Storehouse.
session_synopses.AD_GrumpyAndArrogant: Two goblins talk after a victorious raid at the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndLooters: The warchief hassles two other goblins, demanding why raiding the nearby storehouse is taking so long.
session_synopses.Refugee003: Bex and her partner Danis have been roped into acting as medics for anyone wounded during the attack.
session_synopses.LairDoor: NOTE: the 'lair door' speaker is supposed to be Marcoryl, one of the druid servants (though he is unseen throughout, behind a locked door)Doni the grunting tiefling kid stands by the sealed entrance to the druid lair. A voice from with warns both player and Doni away. It becomes apparent that the druid servants have sealed themselves in the inner sanctum before asn impending goblin attack, Efforts by the player to get them to open the sanctum to others fail  - the servants just want to ensure their own safety.
session_synopses.Grunting: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee004: Goblins have broken in and started killing civilians. Toron shouts with fear and panic.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Guard nervously awaiting the start of a battle. Player may have met previously, when her legs were immobilised by a potion.
session_synopses.AD_DrowCommander: Minthara looks at the map on the table at the den where the leader is after the plea at the gates. She is communing with her god - the Absolute - quietly, as she plans her next move.
session_synopses.RaidersArriveAfterFight: the drow commander and goblins arrive during the attack on the grove to find the player has already gone hostile to the tieflings by attacking them. The drow is amused that the player would start the slaughter without her and either joins them to finish off the tieflings, or gives futher orders if all are dead
session_synopses.RaiderArrogant: archer attacking the tieflings at the grove
session_synopses.Pet004: A boar has just survived an attack on its home and is strutting about the place proudly
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Mino, one of the druids guarding the den, reacts to its successful defence. He also reacts if the tiefling refugees have left and if victory was secured owing to the assassination of the goblin leadership
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is trying to distract the children from battle preparations going on around them.
session_synopses.BirdSender: This dialogue takes place in two different states. The first is after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. In the second state, the goblin leaders have been killed and the tieflings in the grove are leaving. She's aware of the hard work ahead required to make things go back to normal, but she's hopeful all the same.There's an extra node to acknowledge the missing idol, if it went missing before one of those two states were triggered.
session_synopses.AD_BickeringTrainees: Gan and Ide are guard trainees "defending" one of the two hideout entrances together and bicker about which one will kill more goblins.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave: Memnos is burying his friend, Arka, if she died while defending the druid grove. He refers to another tiefling, Kanon, who died during a previous attack.
session_synopses.Refugee004: Refugee on the verge of panic with a battle set to take place outside. Quietly furious the player is not up on the walls protecting them.
session_synopses.ZenBear: After a huge fight at her home, this bear is either depressed and tired because she can't find her master, or happy and content because she's finally found her master.
session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Okta, Ikaron, Danis and Bex are standing around the shelter area waiting for the attack to begin..
session_synopses.Stargazer: The region is under attack by Goblins; she's taken shelter with the rest and is nervous and afraid.
session_synopses.Trainee002: Child who's been trained to fight - swelling with pride and confident they can handle whatever's coming.
session_synopses.Sapper_002: goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Adventurer2: Remira is an adventurer we've already met - she dislikes tieflings but is staying to defend because they gave her injured friend shelter when they didn't have to.
session_synopses.RitualDruid003: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Inwe is rattled to the bone by the battle. She doesn't feel safe in the grove anymore after seeing so much bloodshed.
session_synopses.AD_CheckingBarricade: Lakrissa and Kaldani are going back and forth over a barricade they're building together in preparation for the attack. They're friends joking around to hide their nerves about the incoming goblins..
session_synopses.AD_StupidAndDummy: A dumb raider is fighting against a dummy.
session_synopses.AD_PackingTraders: Lim and Meli are packing away the valuables they've scored..
session_synopses.Servant005: Arron, a druid trader, is truly relieved that the player was able to help everyone. He didn't look forward to what would have happened otherwise.
session_synopses.HarpyKid: A kid in a protected area - think like a bunker during the blitz - waiting for an attack to come. Somebody has been telling him and his friends stories to distract them from what's coming. He looks up to the player because he saved him before.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted. This kid is only present if player saved them from their snake death.
session_synopses.Pet003: The bird returns to the Den after the tieflings win.
session_synopses.MindMeldAfterCombat: A drow commander telepathically communicates with players who have allied with her to slaughter the inhabitants of a druid's grove
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Attack on Den state.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan (the prodigy) reacts to the successful defence of the grove, in the event that he was convinced to stay.
session_synopses.Mule2: Ox dialogue during and after the den gets raided by goblins.
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee003: Player has turned on the tiefligns and is coming after them!
session_synopses.AD_CoweringRefugee002: Triggered when goblins break in to slaughter unarmed civilians.
session_synopses.Tiefling003: Cook - losing prospect at prospect of enduring a siege.
session_synopses.Kid004: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.
session_synopses.ScoutCaptive: A druid we've saved twice from goblins thanks us after a major attack. This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove.
session_synopses.SonOfChef: This is Ikaron's solo dialogue. It occurs in the Attack on Den state. It can occur after his dual dialogue with Okta or if the player spoke to him before triggering that scene.
session_synopses.AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend: Memnos is outraged after the player betrays the refugees in favour of the attacking goblins.
session_synopses.WarchiefGrumpy: Goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingOnGate: Arka talks to herself while manning the Grove's defences, working herself up for the imminent battle against attacking goblins. She mentions her dead friend Kanon and all the goblins she intends to kill in his name.
session_synopses.Pet002: After victory following a huge goblin attack on his home, a wolf feels satisfied with a job well done, but warns you not to ruin the peace..
session_synopses.AD_HalsinJoinsFight: AD that plays when Halsin joins the fight against the goblin raiders, after the player betrays the tieflings.
session_synopses.Servant004: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Elwyn is shaken - she's spent a long time worried about the safety of the grove, and had given up hope once the goblins arrived. After the goblins were defeated, she realises her fear had gotten the better of her.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions: Mol is looking over the valuables that have been gathered by her underlings and advises them as they prepare to journey to Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.TorturedAdventurer: Oneliner when we find the tortured adventurer sleeping in the grove during the attack on the den.
session_synopses.AD_LairDoor: The person behind the locked druid sanctum door (Marcoryl the druid servant) yells at Doni (grunting kid) to get lost.
session_synopses.RitualDruid002: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Kerrick feels ashamed for having participated in a ritual that would have driven the tieflings out, especially after having just fought beside them against the goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Prodigies: The prodigy and his brother and sister are having an argument about their role in the defense of the grove.
session_synopses.Sapper_003: a goblin carrying explosives in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAtBarricade: Asharak is on the gate with Kaldani, before the goblins attack. Surveying her work..
session_synopses.Trainer:
Asharak has been tasked with getting civilians prepared for war. He hopes having the player on their side might make the difference.
If the tiefling leader is dead, Asharak reluctantly steps into his shoes.
session_synopses.Trainee003: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.RaiderBossy: A goblin raider celebrates upon having successfully destroyed a shelter full of refugees. Jubilant and nasty.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: Kagha dialogue if Attack on Den has occurred. Various states included in this dialogue
session_synopses.PAD_DeadKids: Player finds dead tiefling children, killed by goblins, after assisting the goblins in a raid on the grove. NOTE: this dialog only triggers if players chose to side against the tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_LootingGoblins: Two goblins are looting the area near the cook and adventurer areas before burning it to the ground.
session_synopses.EntranceMeeting: Zevlor or Asharak are manning the wall of the grove, which is sealed up tight against a coming invasion. They're astonished to see an ally (the player) emerge from the trees and order their soldiers not to shoot.
session_synopses.Griefling: A tiefling preparing for the goblin assault on the grove - she's scared but excited about the attack because she sees it as a chance to avenge her friend, Kanon, who was killed by goblins earlier. She's trying to sound more sure of herself than she is.
session_synopses.RaiderViolent: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid001: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Aelar is still in a bit of a daze from chanting for so long. He doesn't quite believe everything that's happened.
session_synopses.RaiderHardy: A goblin taking part in a raid on a druid grove
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: Dialogue for the lazy bear sleeping next to the elevator after the den has been attacked.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndPotions: The warchief sees through the arsonists who failed to loot the storehouse and orders them to get to looting despite the fire.
session_synopses.EntranceMeetingWyll: Player returns to den after letting Wyll return beforehand. NOTE: A NARRATOR NODE IS REQUIRED IN THE FIRST NODE BECAUSE IT IS A SPEAKER SELECTION WITH A CINEMATIC.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove, in the event that the prodigy and co were convinced to stay.
session_synopses.RaiderCrafty: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.
session_synopses.AD_RaidersAtPool: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
session_synopses.LeaderKid: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
session_synopses.AD_CaringForOx: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.
session_synopses.AD_RikkaAndDoni: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.
session_synopses.ChefAndSon: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.GoblinLush: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_BossyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.
session_synopses.RaiderStupid: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Mule1: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.
session_synopses.Apprentice: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonPacking: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived
session_synopses.AD_CoweringStargazer: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.
session_synopses.BackupVictory: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..
session_synopses.Trainee001: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.
session_synopses.RaiderBold: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove
session_synopses.Sapper_001: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.
session_synopses.RaiderCunning: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight
session_synopses.AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.
session_synopses.AD_LoversOverTortured: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.
session_synopses.Tiefling010: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
session_synopses.RaiderFunny: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge
session_synopses.RaiderChieftain: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RaiderHefty: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Servant001: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.
session_synopses.AD_PotionRaiders: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.
session_synopses.Melee_001: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.AD_Sappers: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriend: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.
session_synopses.ParentA: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.
session_synopses.Refugee001: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.
session_synopses.AD_GettingArmed: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.
session_synopses.WarchiefBrave: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, one of the druid grove's guards, reacts to their victory in defending their home. She may also react to the tiefling refugees having left.
session_synopses.AD_CraftyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.AD_CharmedKidStory: Mirkon is a fallback, telling a story if the bard isn't present. He's excitedly telling the story about how he got caught by the harpies and the player rescued him.
session_synopses.HalsinReturns: The Druid Grove has been saved (because either the attacking force was repelled or its leaders were assassinated) and Halsin returns. He thanks the player and reacts to events that may have transpired in the grove during his absence. He's previously promised to help the player with their tadpole problem, but he defers this discussion until the next morning after the victory celebrations.
session_synopses.AD_InstructionsForKids: Rikka is firmly giving instructions to children before they depart on a dangerous journey.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Gan
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill so many goblins.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Challenging - "You can't be doing more than me!"

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill six hundred.

session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Mirkon
AfterHarpyEncounter.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering in fear (he's hunkering down, with his hands over his face/ears). Scripter note: Use the generic cower or some approximation for consistency with scripter animations.

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Player
AfterHarpyEncounter.text: They're gone. Are you all right?

VB_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
VB_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.speaker: Harpy
AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.context: NodeContext: Feral bird-woman - a scream of rage and hunger

AD_HarpyInterrupted.speaker: Harpy
AD_HarpyInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Feral bird-woman - rage and hunger

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.VB_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.AD_HarpyAttackedEarly: AD when player attacks the Harpy leader before the proper combat starts
session_synopses.AD_HarpyInterrupted: AD that fires when the player wakes up the halfling (the harpy's prey) from his enchantment.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Hello, petal! Need anything? Any lotions or potions?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cheerful and sincere. This is her second time meeting the player. Acting like they're friends already.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. I've been infected by a mind flayer parasite.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you recount your adventure, Auntie Ethel nods along - her eyes wide.*
You poor pet. My heart goes out to you, truly.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She clutches her chest, looking incredibly concerned and sympathetic. NodeContext: Deep concern and sounds sincere. Very worried about the player.

node_data.text: I see no sign of a tentacle yet, but that could change in an instant. You need help, serious help.
I've ne'er a potion or lotion here that could do it, but...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, concerned as she tries to think of something. Shaking her head.

node_data.text: ...yes. I may have something at home!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes light up. Smiles. NodeContext: Hope and cheer in her voice. She sounds like she genuinely wants to help.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Such as?
I've collected some... interesting bits 'n bobs over the years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hinting slightly that there's something else going on at her home, but very subtle. Like a slightly cheeky hint.

node_data.text: You'll have to stop by my house - just at the edge of the forest!
Let me mark it on your map. I'll be heading back soon, so I can meet you there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to entice the player to come to her home, cheerful.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What harm? Show me your wares.
Be careful on the road - I'd hate if something happened to you. Take care, petal.

VB_HagLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_HagLeaves.text: That old woman was certainly memorable.
VB_HagLeaves.context: NodeContext: Positive but unsure. She was charming but also strange.

session_synopses: Auntie Ethel appears to be a charmingly roguish old lady selling potions in the grove. She is actually a hag in disguise. The player can explain what happened with the tadpole and Ethel offers to meet them at her home in order to 'help them'. The player can also get poison from her for the goblin camp, but she asks them to do her a favour instead.
session_synopses.VB_HagLeaves: VB played when the player sees the Hag leave the Den.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
