node_data.text: If it ain't the fearless goblin-slayer.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Aggressive, but not powerfully so. He's not a friendly guy.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: You sure you want to be seen with me? I ain't exactly popular with this lot.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with a grimace - 'this lot' refers specifically to the tiefling refugees who are nearby but not necessarily in-shot, but he's grumpy enough that it also refers to just about everybody in the world

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You could try to be a little friendlier.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Charming. I can see why the locals like you so much.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Them devils ain't local - they're refugees. Fella who runs this place offered 'em shelter.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And whose home is this exactly?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Druids. And they ain't the friendly type. The only one of 'em worth a damn was the leader, and he ain't here anymore.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What makes you say they're not friendly?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: They like trees more than they like people.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You got along with their leader, though?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Better than the others, but not well enough to risk my neck for him.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You ran away from a few goblins?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered.text: The Idol of Silvanus! Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Kanon
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX: Death cry - While turning the wheel to open the gate, Kanon gets hit by an arrow in the neck and dies

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Remira
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX description: Heavy lifting efforts to try to keep gate open (along with Aradin & Barth). It's too heavy so the gate slams shut

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been tampered with. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Only going to ask you one more time, boy. Hand over my locket.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: I don't have your ugly locket. I've never even seen it before!

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Hand it over or I'll slap the teeth out of your head.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Don't you dare lay a finger on that child.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Raise a hand to that child and you'll lose it. Your choice.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: Guards! This human is trying to hurt me and my friend!

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: When do I get to run the ring scam?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Silfy needs the practice. You'll be out there soon enough.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: I bet that scam is going to kill in Baldur's Gate.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't get too attached to that con, kids. I got bigger plans for the city.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to grab her, but she escapes their grasp.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.RobbedAdventurer:
Non-critpath. A human adventurer accuses a tiefling child of stealing a necklace from him. A tiefling guard may intervene if things get out of hand. 

Barth: Angry, but gruff and restrained. 
Meli: Fearless, urging Barth on.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: To think we almost finished the ritual...
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: I felt honoured when I was chosen to participate. Now I feel guilty I didn't object.
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: Do you hear them? The birds. They're beautiful.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I've thought of nothing but goblins and tieflings for so long, I stopped listening.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's referring to her anxiety preventing her from listening to the birds in the grove.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Elwyn is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Elwyn is conflicted - she knows why the ritual had to be stopped, but she's scared that they've been left defenceless.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Elwyn is calm but exhausted, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.The player always encounters Elwyn around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid3: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.
session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: Now that that's settled, we can get to finding a healer.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerWakesUp: Player when the adventurer leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.
session_synopses.OpenGate: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderSpotsWyll: Plays when Avatar is Wyll in raiding party, during combat.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation: AD the adventurer leader says just before running into the Den to confront the tiefling leader.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.VB_PeacefulResolution: VB if everyone survived the confrontation in Raiding Party.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text: *'Harp and wild'? You recall stories of an alliance between druids and the Harpers, but the details are vague.*

VB_BrokenRunes.speaker: Player
VB_BrokenRunes.text: It's broken, but not too badly.

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.speaker: Player
PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.text: It's opened. I wonder what's back there.
PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Slightly understated since it could be a tense situation.

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.FrescoAlliance: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting two sides agreeing an alliance. Pass a test to realise that one side are the druids of the wild, and the other the Harpers - a secret organisation.
session_synopses.VB_BrokenRunes: Player finds a broken rune amongst some ruins.
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.
session_synopses.PAD_UnlockWithCirclet: Played only once, ever.This player opened one of the stone slabs in the secret library using the magic circlet.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Player
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: Apologise. You were mistaken to touch their holy relic.
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.

session_synopses.AD: Idle ADs for the tiefling blacksmith.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Stop it! You're not going to find the antidote.

Apprentice.speaker: Player
Apprentice.text: Then help me. Give me a chance to beat this.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I can't. I can't let you endanger this camp.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Please, just sit down. Make your prayers. Let things take their course.

session_synopses.Apprentice: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has done something to annoy her (ie. Stolen, damaged, or moved something she owned, or been caught trying to pick her pocket.) Nettie has poisoned the player, and is wary of you finding the antidote while looking around.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: How long will it take to get to Baldur's Gate?
AD.context: NodeContext: Cheerful, you're glad the argument is over. Bantering with your family.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Depends. How often are you going to ask that?
AD.context: NodeContext: A note of humour in your voice - very much a 'are we there yet, are we there yet' situation.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: Hey, sis. How long will it take to get to Baldur's Gate?
AD.context: NodeContext: You know you're being annoying and you're enjoying yourself.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: A big dramatic sigh even as you're enjoying the banter,

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees the landscape ahead through the telescope lens - the dragon is gone

Telescope.speaker: Player
Telescope.text: Focus the telescope on the distant object, trying to get a clear view.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.text: *You see a dragon circling like a bird of prey. Hunting.*
Telescope.context: NodeContext: watching the dragon through a telescope so fear but no immediate danger

session_synopses.Telescope: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Wyll
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: Harsh. Remind me to stay on your good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: You were never on my good side.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Zevlor.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: By Dhelt's virtue, the Blade of Frontiers? What's happened, Wyll?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dhelt = delt.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: I paid the price of angering the wrong devil.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Believe me - I understand better than most.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A moment passes as Zevlor contemplates Wyll's words. He then turns his attentions to you.*

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: I'd advise you to settle your affairs here quickly.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grim, lot on his mind

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Once the druids complete their ritual, we'll be sharing the road with goblins once again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but resigned

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Unless you've reconsidered speaking to them for us? Kagha might listen to you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We turned him down before - he's hopeful that we might change our mind

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll speak to the druids.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll see what I can do.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: I knew I liked you.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: We'd owe you a great debt. If we're forced to leave now, more of my people will die.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: You'll find the druids at the heart of the grove. Please - make them see sense, before more lives are lost.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Oh, and if it's of any concern... you're brave to walk around without hiding your heritage. I'll make sure everyone knows that you helped us at the gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Addressing an awkward topic before he forgets - most would run from your race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

AD.speaker: Zevlor
AD.context: NodeContext: Grim. Worried. He's reached his cave and is contemplating the journey ahead.

session_synopses: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. In the same dialogue, we can also uncover that he is in fact a traitor, concerned only with getting these people through the goblins so he can trade them for his own safety later. In truth he is resentful and contemptuous of them, viewing them as weak.
session_synopses.AD_Victory: Plays after the tieflings won Attack on Den or after completing Goblin Hunt. Zevlor is standing on the plateform above the gate of the Grove and he's watching the other tieflings below.
session_synopses.AD: Zevlor is at his default spot in the tieflings cave. Normally he has an AD with Tilses, but if she's dead or otherwise unavailable, he uses this solo AD instead.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Did some bleeding hearts show up to save the druid? I'll cut ya to pieces.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Kill 'em!
node_data.context: NodeContext: shouting an order to other nearby goblins as he prepares to attack the player

AD_CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
AD_CapturedGoblin.text: They ain't as friendly as me. Not as clever either. Kill 'em.
AD_CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: sly, vicious on last two words

session_synopses: Reaction from Goblin Scouts if they're approached in the tunnels. They attack even if Sazza is present.
session_synopses.AD_CapturedGoblin: Sazza tells players to kill other goblins while she is being rescued from the grove

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: So you can handle yourself. Not bad - those druids really should have known better.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

AD_Refugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: I just want to go home.
Trainee001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He just wants to go back home and be safe again.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: Goblins might not even come. Right?

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.text: You're alive! Did you get the idol? Is that why they went crazy?
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: surprised, pleased, slightly breathless - she has been hiding from an attack, and just realised it's over

HideoutLeader.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader.text: I don't have it. Let's just be glad we're alive.

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: Frustrated to have lost out on a treasure

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You're a person with many faces.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: I was able to wiggle a toe earlier - I guess that potion is finally wearing off. Terrible timing, as usual.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: I knew Kagha had twisted them, but for so many to turn on us...

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: Thank you for standing with us. I need to check on my people, but come see me when you have a chance.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: When do you think the goblins will attack?

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: Could be a day or a season - bad timing for us either way.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We'll just have to prepare as best we can.

AD_Trainer.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer.text: Children - find a place to hide. Don't come out 'til I call.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: How long will you be down here, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Just until it's safe to go out. Don't worry. How about a story in the meantime?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: A little petulant sounding but you actually really wanted a story

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

PetWolf.speaker: Silver
PetWolf.text: Master says you're good. Told me to protect you. But one wrong move, and your flesh is mine.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: Thought we were safe here. But nowhere's safe, is it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: You look ready. Wish it were contagious.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: I'm glad we were here - who knows what would have happened otherwise?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: Thanks for gutting the druid bastards. Only wish I could've taken a few myself.

ExcitedBoar.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar.text: I should've known. All two-legs are the same!

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: I'm worried. I don't think we're ready.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: Lakrissa's right. Can only do what we can.

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

RangerTrader.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: CinematicNodeContext: (idol stolen)InternalNodeContext: Reaction from druids if players steal the idol in their vicinity without being pacified first.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.text: The time has come. Remove the outsiders.
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: A grim conclusion at the end - a call for a huge battle between druids and tieflings.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: Calling for the druids to attack all the inhabitants of the grove.

DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Scammer.speaker: Nerela
Scammer.context: NodeContext: She's trying to act natural.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: I got three. Or five. I forget.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: I think we made those animal people mad.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: One of the other tiefling children stole an idol from the druids - she thinks they're attacking because they're mad about that. She's scared.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.text: We had the druids to worry us before. Not anymore. We can defend this place.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.text: This place could use a little light.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: a little wry. she wants to cut down some trees.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can beat them, can't you?

AD_SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef.text: We're done running. Hold your ground!

AD_ParentA.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: No, Zaki. It'll be over soon.

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

AD_DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed.text: Silvanus forgive me for what I must do.

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith_PostEA: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
session_synopses.AD_Trainer: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.
session_synopses.AD_YoungLover01: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.
session_synopses.AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.
session_synopses.Kid004: Kid responses related to druid attack.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.
session_synopses.PetWolf: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.
session_synopses.Protester3: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.
session_synopses.AD_DruidLeader: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
session_synopses.ParentB: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
session_synopses.ExcitedBoar: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.
session_synopses.AD_ServantPlight: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.
session_synopses.AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.
session_synopses.AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.
session_synopses.Protester2: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)
session_synopses.RangerTrader: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
session_synopses.LINE_DruidToCombat: The player angered the druids by tampering with the Idol of Silvanus of by performing a serious crime.Kagha reacts if it's triggering near her. Otherwise, 'generic' druids are used for the off screen voices and call to arms shot.Can also trigger if the player goes hostile to Kagha in dialogue.
session_synopses.IrritatedTiefling: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.
session_synopses.DruidOpposed: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Protester1: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)
session_synopses.Scammer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_TraineesAfterAttack: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.
session_synopses.AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack
session_synopses.RobberKid: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling001: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.
session_synopses.AD_SonOfChef: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.
session_synopses.AD_ParentA: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.
session_synopses.ServantPlight: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.
session_synopses.ParentA: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.
session_synopses.AD_FoodTrader: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.
session_synopses.AD_DruidGuard1: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.
session_synopses.YoungLover02: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.
session_synopses.DruidGuard002: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.AD_Apprentice: Nettie and the other druids are forced to drive out the tieflings by force. ADs cover the attack, moving to attack position, and ADs while Nettie's waiting to strike. Nettie doesn't want to kill anyone, and hopes the tieflings will leave until the very end, but will fight if she needs to.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeader: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.AD_DruidOpposed: Rath is defending the tieflings as Sagha and the other druids attempt to drive them out.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers
session_synopses.WRLD_GettingBloodFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for redcap getting blood from a trough

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: You protected a child-stealing vampire? Bold choice.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: Let's hope it doesn't come back to bite me later.

session_synopses.PAD_ProtectedAstarion: This voicebark plays when a player chooses to not give up Astarion to the Gur hunter.Speaker 1 is assumed to be the player who did this action, and speaker 2 may have an opinionated comment on the outcome.Astarion can be neither of the speakers.

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *The sheep's voice warbles. You realise it's trying to say 'Baa'.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Player
IllusionRedcap.text: Drop your eyes and carefully reach out.

session_synopses.IllusionRedcap:
This occurs in the swamp. Sheep wander the area - except they're redcaps (a type of violent faerie) hidden by the hag's illusions. The creatures are pretending to be sheep. 
The illusion can be shattered by an animal handling check. OR if the player preciously succeeded in a perception check in the area.

Brother_002_AD_Fallback.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

AD_HagDisappear.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Bloody hells, she just disappeared. Ain't seen nothing like that before.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue, The hag has vanished and your left terrified. This monster has your sister and the sheer magnitude of the situation is hitting you.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: She could shoot fireworks out of her backside for all I care; the hag has Rina.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your brother is afraid of the hag and you're having none of it. The hag has your sister and you'd fight a thousand of those monsters to save Mayrina - you're pissed that your brother isn't the same.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Will someone please tell me what's going on?

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: It's our sister - Mayrina. She is... well, she was in a bad way after her husband died.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. Your voice is gentle as you discuss the trauma Mayrina has gone through - obvious that you love her and are worried about her.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Started saying weird things, like how she was gonna bring him back.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. You're scared but are hiding it beneath anger and frustration.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Next thing, she's gone looking for the hag. Of all the stupid things to do.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: You're terrified for your sister and her child and are struggling to justify her reasons for disappearing. You think she's being foolish and naive.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: We haven't seen her since, and no good ever came from dealing with a hag.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: None of this matters, all right? We need to get her back. And fast.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your brother keeps talking and you're getting more angry and scared. You need to leave and find your sister - you're terrified of what will happen if you don't.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment.text: You're on your own. I have enough problems.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: And we've no need of a mouthy bastard.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Come on, Demir. We'll make our own way.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

session_synopses.Brother_002_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.AD_HagDisappear: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.
session_synopses.Brothers_Recruitment: The main dialogue for Demir and Johl. In their post ambush dialogue, the player has sided with them and the hag has disappeared. They want to save Mayrina but are overwhelmed and ill-equipped to deal with the situation. Player can accompany them or tell them that the player will handle it alone. The player can also abandon them to their fates.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.

Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.text: No, Ethel! I'm sorry! I'll go back! Argh.

Victim_001_AD_Dying.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_AD_Dying.text: The Bite! No. I don't want to die. I don't - Argh.
Victim_001_AD_Dying.context: NodeContext: You're about to puke your guts up and die a horrible death. You feel it coming - you're panicked, scared and terrified.

session_synopses.Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack: Lorin has been ordered to stay in the corner by the hag. The player has forced him out, and he is absolutely panicking - he knows the hag will punish him. He calls out, begging for forgiveness before clutching his heart as he experiences a massive heart attack and collapses on the floor - dead.
session_synopses.Victim_001_AD_Dying: Edgecase for if you don't speak to the victim and he has to die. You're about to puke your guts up after being de-petrified

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

PAD_Fled.speaker: Player
PAD_Fled.text: Where has she gone, I wonder?

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.PAD_Fled: In the top node player has started combat with the hag in the teahouse. She has disappeared, fleeing to her lair. In the bottom, business has been conducted peacefully and she has left.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who are you?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Today? The same as you - a humble supplicant, come to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My business here is my own.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: As you like. But you needn't be coy - whatever's worth knowing, rest assured she already knows it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, not fazed by our secrecy though he thinks it unnecessary

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And are you fool enough?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Of course. I'm a hunter who lost his prey, and here I am seeking help from something worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Amused and absolutely accepting of his own foolishness

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing grave

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd like to trade.

session_synopses.Dead: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.
session_synopses: Male, middle-age or older.Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.

session_synopses.Frog_AtReward: This is a small frog in the swamp lands.She has been twisted by Ethel's magic and is desperately trying not to hurt the player - doing everything she can to hold back. If Ethel is dead, the frog is very cheerful and sing song - hopping about. If they player asks for a reward, she cheerfully spits on their shoes and hops off.

PAD_PrickedFinger.speaker: Player
PAD_PrickedFinger.context:
NodeContext: Noise of pain. Your finger has been pricked by a thorn.

Karlach: 'Fing' is on purpose

session_synopses.PAD_PrickedFinger: The player has pricked their finger on a thorny bush. The player encounters a thorny bush full of fruit. In order to take the fruit from the bush without cutting theirself, the player must pass a Sleight of Hand test.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Someone cut these men to pieces. I doubt they had time to scream.
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.context: InternalNodeContext: No idea who brothers are

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.text: Where's the teahouse? What's going on?
SurrogateMother.context: InternalNodeContext: Ethel is in the lair but Mayrina is not in the Lair.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother.text: I got you away from Ethel. You're welcome.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.text: But where did she go? What is going on?
SurrogateMother.context: NodeContext: Trying to make sense of things. You break off as you jump - frightened.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.context: NodeContext: Frightened and trying to keep it together as you look around.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother.text: Stay put. I'll be back soon.

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

AD_HusbandGrave.speaker: Player
AD_HusbandGrave.text: 'Here lies Connor - beloved husband, and a tasty little morsel to boot.'
AD_HusbandGrave.context: NodeContext: Above a gravestone - a cruel jab.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother: These are the main dialogue states for Mayrina. They included - when the player rescues Mayrina, when the player kills the hag, when the illusion dissapates,  and her main dialogue states in the teahouse (bottom two branches.)
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.
session_synopses.AD_HusbandGrave: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The eye's glassy black surface reflects your gaze.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: the 'eye' is large, magical and floating around watching you

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you gaze deeper, you feel a focus. An intent.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: this 'intent' is unnerving

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach out to the presence.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel a brief, lurching connection. The sensation of falling into your own image, endlessly.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: unnerving

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Confusion. Alarm. Then the presence withdraws - leaving a dull black mirror once more.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: urgency and mystery - the 'dull black mirror' is the surface of the crying eye

session_synopses: The scrying eye is a floating eye that acts as a sort of magical security camera. This one is hovering around the goblin camp spying on players and broadcasting back to Moonrise Towers. The presence watching is a drow at moonrise.

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Crusher
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX : The goblin bends over and kisses the player's foot
DrunkGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped InternalNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Brawler Tiny
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins cackle as the drunk goblin point out the player kissed his feet

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Brawler Tiny
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins menacingly cackle as the drunk goblin threatens the player

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought Flaming Fist?

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: That last inn we 'it. They were guardin' some uppity noble 'n his friends.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost bored at the story - she's describing an incident of great significance to you but she only cares about the fight and the spoils it brings

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Not very well, mind. Yer drow pals carried him off, left the real spoils to us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive. Both of the mercenaries who couldn't put up a fight, and of the fact that the drow only cared about taking hostages, leave the real valuables (in her eyes) behind

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you know about Moonrise Towers?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: All I need to - there's an awful lot of folk flowing that way, and coin is sure to follow.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She doesn't share your curiosity - but she sees the opportunity for business in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Might have to find my faith and see this Absolute for myself, eh?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Speculative, joking - she'll happily pretend to be relgious if it means making a deal

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Still some deals to be done here, though - you want to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyeing you up, bringing you back to the topic at hand

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
