node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It'll be a very short lifetime if you don't hand me the manuscript.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Bloody hell - an' people say goblins are savage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid - we're bullying him

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: It ain't worth fightin' over. Take it!
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset afraid, we're bullying him

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a spell to speak with a corpse - matter of fact despite the weird situation

session_synopses.Dead: players use a spell to speak with the corpse of a powerful drow commander at the goblin camp

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: 'Ere - you 'eard about wot happened on that last raid? Right so, some slob 'ad the drop on me...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eager to tell this story to anyone who'll listen

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Then she falls flat on 'er face with an arrow in 'er back! That's the Absolute that is. Protectin' me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: Been boozin'? If ya need to clear yer head, priestess can help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We've just arrived from a party so she thinks we might be drunk - friendly

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: She'd rather be cuttin' folks than curin 'em, but she knows her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly advice

session_synopses: A goblin participating in a religious ceremony.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

Backup_04.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nozk
Backup_04.text: You outsiders never have ta guard the borin' posts.

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.
session_synopses.Backup_04: One of the guards at the door to the inner temple. He's been standing here for a while and shouldn've been switched out a while ago, but the change of guard never showed. He's very bored.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Hold up your hands to show you mean no harm.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You really wouldn't.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Of course, the Absolute protects us now, but still...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's still a bit awestruck about what just happened.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Get movin'. I got other customers.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Wot are you s'posed to be? You look like a dead elf wot got left out in the sun for too long.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: sneering, mocking. He's a cocky teenager who just met a gith (alien creature; not well known) for the first time

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: I am an alien warrior from another plane of existence.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Sure you are. An' I'm king of the hobgoblins.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: reacting to a player who made an outlandish claim, replying with one of his own. He's a smug teenager

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: 'Avin' a drink? 'S all the sweeter when it's free, innit?
Goblin002.context: NodeContext: Nastily amused, referencing the fact that they burned an inn down to get the drink. Treating you like you're in on the joke.

Goblin002.speaker: Player
Goblin002.text: Is it? Looks like swill to me.

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: Aye, but can't expect proper stuff from them fancy inns, can ya?

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: I swear, I got more dizzy from the smoke when we burned the place down.
Goblin002.context: NodeContext: Sharing a joke with you about how weak the ale is.

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: Oi, get off! I killed him - he's mine!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.context: CinematicNodeContext: planer knelt looting bodyNodeContext: wave hands to shoo looting player.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Player
Goblin005.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.Goblin002: This goblin is a chatty one, enjoying the party and making pleasant conversation. She assumes you're here for the same reasons she is - enjoying the spoils of a recent brutal raid.
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.
session_synopses.GoblinKid002_LootingCrime: An unpleasant goblin kid's crime reaction on looting dead adventurer's body.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Backup003.speaker: Warlock Tud
Backup003.text: Lookin' at a future True Soul, you are. Boss Ragzlin says I'm next in line!

Backup003.speaker: Wyll
Backup003.text: Boss Ragzlin, eh? Must be the goblin in charge.
Backup003.context: NodeContext: Wyll overheard gpoblin mention Ragzlin, pronounced "RAGS-lin." That means his target is close.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Backup003: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Very stoked about the Absolute.A little drunk. A hiccup or two wouldn't be out of place :)
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

session_synopses.SlowDown_NoGoblins: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely after they apply a brake. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *You test the weight of the chains, looking for weak points.*
Chains.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player chained with their arms behind, they're attached to a stone post

Chains.speaker: Player
Chains.text: Tense your muscles, straining against the chains.

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *The chains snap as you expand your chest.*

session_synopses.Chains: Character is interacting with the priestess' chains.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Found yer manners?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin sneers and hold out his foot.NodeContext: He asked us to kiss his feet, we ran away, and now we've come back. He wants to humiliate us some more.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: I'm waitin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Smug. He wants us to kiss his feet and there's nothing we can do about it (or so he thinks)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Kneel down in front of him.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Good pet.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another close-up of his foot, just to remind us how gross it is.NodeContext: condescending

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: That's more like it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: close-up of his foot: his nails are cracked and black with mud, but we should clearly see a ring glittering on his big left toe.NodeContext: condescending - he asked us to kiss his feet and we got on our knees.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Kiss his foot - and try to slide the ring off his toe.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As your lips touch filthy flesh, you catch a whiff of... lavender?*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pleasant scent gives way to the muddy taste of something you try not to identify. You carefully slide the ring off.*

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: You enjoyin' that? Disgustin' worm. Just remember: you're nuffing 'ere.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: We're at his feet still, so he's talking down to us. We get up during the last sentence.NodeContext: We've just kissed his feet for a long time. He's trying to humiliate us even further.

node_data.speaker: Gale
node_data.text: Well! I've never seen sleight of tongue quite like that before.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Let us hope we don't see it again.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Did you see a druid named Halsin?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

session_synopses: Annoyed at being interrupted while he's telling a story over a beer, this goblin wants to humiliate you in front of his lackeys.
session_synopses.Dead: SwD dialog for Crusher, an absolute legend (pun intended) among the goblin tribe.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: You see that eye wotsit floatin' about? Best hope it don't take a fancy to you...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding as if towards the 'wotsit'.NodeContext: Conspiratol tone. He doesn't like the 'device' and takes issue with it.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: ... unless you like playin' hide an' seek when yer tryin' to take a dump.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Crass. Obviously speaking from experience.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What is it?

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: It's a floatin' eye, mate. What do you reckon? Bloody spyin' on us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what the device is doing here. Goblin reacts like it's a stupid question (it is).

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: The bigwigs at Moonrise like to 'be involved', the drow says.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'be involved' said in a mocking tone, clearly imitating the drow. And badly. Irritated and annoyed at the reasoning.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: Load o' trollop. Jus' don't trust us to do what we do best - killin' things.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a huff. Annoyed and offended.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

Spiders_CantSpeak.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak.text: *The spider seems poised to attack, but she hesitates, tapping her claws as if trying to communicate.*

Spiders_CantSpeak.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak.text: *You, however, are unable to speak. Her hesitation turns to impatience.*
Spiders_CantSpeak.context: NodeContext: Starts combat, the spider lunges.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.Spiders_CantSpeak: Two giant spiders trap the player. Normally, the player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above. But in this case, the player is unable to speak and can't make their case.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.text: |I still have info to exctract from prisoner. Don't do anything funny!|

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin raises a club, ready to hit the adventurer, but then notices the player and stops.NodeContext: He's torturing an adventurer and getting sadistic pleasure from this.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: You again? Wanna join 'im this time?

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: Why are you still torturing him?

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: Some other git found the grove before we did. Made us look real stupid, 'e did.
Torture.context: NodeContext: a little sour at the memory

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: So now we're makin' sure this lad regrets not tellin' us.
Torture.context: NodeContext: deriving sadistic pleasure from this.

session_synopses.Torture: One of the goblins is torturing a prisoner, either to find out where the grove is, or just because he wants to. The player can try to get rid of him - if Shadowheart is present, she gives some advice on how to do so. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has unique options criticising the goblin's techniques.
session_synopses.Rat_000: Rat in the torture cell who is starving because all the prisoners have been carted away.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
node_data.text: Don't let our little pet scare ya, mate. Bloody bugbear couldn't break those bars.

session_synopses: Goblin is telling player of the captive they've placed in the wolf pens.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why would I let anyone scar me for life?

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't just a mark on the flesh: it's magic. Only them what follows the Absolute can see it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: as if trying to explain something obvious to an idiot

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Let's us know you're on our side. That way, nobody'll mess with ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining something simple, talking down to us a little

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking advice

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And why did they turn on you?

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.
session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Trespassing: This goblin is nearly blackout drunk and unsteady on his feet, but still trying to perform guard duties.

node_data.speaker: Polma
node_data.text: You. Not supposed to be here. Leave!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Slow, stupid. Identifying us, pointing on 'you'. Then figuring out we're trespassing before roaring at us to 'leave'.

session_synopses: An ogre that acts as a guard in the goblin priestess' chapel. Will warn players away if they enter the chapel area - will attack them if they escape from the priestess' dungeon.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Pick a different brain. I can't help you.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I'll be no trouble, my friend. Name a location and I'd be happy to meet you there.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

session_synopses.Volo_Massacre: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

Melee_01.speaker: Yerle
Melee_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, stony-faced. You keep trying to talk to her and she has no interest.

session_synopses.Melee_01: This guard is more aggressive than her counterpart. She's a thug/bouncer, and you're trying to stick your nose where you have no business.

Goblin_002.speaker: Sharp-Eye Crub
Goblin_002.text: You're either with the Absolute or against her. Ain't no in-between.

session_synopses.Goblin_002: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following.speaker: Player
Halsin_Following.text: Gesture for him to wait here.

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Watcha standing 'ere all dry fer? C'mere, have a drink!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin waves the player over and holds out a drink. (she should be holding two cups, one in each hand). The player isn't on the cage yet.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: What should we toast to, eh?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player isn't on the cage yet,

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm glad you asked. Tell everyone to gather round...

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Guys! This 'un's givin' us a toast!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player teleported next to the goblin. She should turn to the left to address the other goblins. The other goblins go and refill their beer.NodeContext: The goblin is calling over the other goblins standing around.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You raise your glass and shout...*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: To drinking 'til we die!

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
node_data.text: To findin' those looters and crushin' 'em!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: All the goblins should raise their cups.InternalNodeContext: There should be a cheer of multiple (3) goblins at the end of this node.NodeContext: The goblin is making a toast.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Now you!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You raise your glass and shout...*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: To Myrkul, lord of bones!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblins blink at you in confusion.*
NodeContext: Do not record.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Do not record.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Go on, drink up!
node_data.context: NodeContext: good-natured.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Spill the beer, then pretend to drink from the empty cup.
True

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: That's it - down the hatch.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The player finally drank, she's happy and encouragin them to drink more.

node_data.text: NodeContext: Do not record.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Do not record.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
node_data.text: Now get outta my way - I need another drink!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly jest.

session_synopses: A goblin comes up to you after you've poisoned the beer and gives you a glass of newly poisoned alcohol, proposing a toast. She's standing on a cage (about 2m high) together with the player.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! What's the bloody ruckus out there?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and on-guard - she's heard a great deal of noise outside and you, a stranger, have just stumbled in

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll be asking the questions.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oh! B-beg pardon, True Soul! At y'service, of course.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Alarmed - she's just spoken sharply to someone who can kill her without a second thought.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who's in charge around here?

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: We follow the Absolute and them She speaks through.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: At first we thought it were just Priestess Gut and Boss Ragzlin. Then the drow came along.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining how things have changed.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Between the two of you, we're swimmin' in drow. Go ahead, I'm sure she's expectin' you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Toeing the line of disrespectul.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: The Absolute is gatherin' us all together. For something big, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Anticipation, confidence that their god has big plans for them

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance.speaker: Player
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: When the event flag CancelPenance is set, Osiris takes care of clearing more flags and resetting the penance

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses.Penance: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
session_synopses.RewardPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

Escapee_Dead.speaker: Player
Escapee_Dead.text: Were you the only prisoner here?

Escapee_Dead.speaker: Dead Elf
Escapee_Dead.text: Goblins took... my friends. Cut them up... for the worgs. For meat.

session_synopses.Escapee_Dead: A dead body is found trapped in a half-dug prison hole. After freeing him, it's clear he died attempting to escape the prison before ended up like the rest as worg chow.

Mindflayer_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

session_synopses.Mindflayer_Dead: The player casts speak with dead on the corpse of the mind flayer that tortured them at the beginning of the game.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: That's the spirit! Now show me the coin.
Commentator.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking the bet because jumping to the betting nodes which can be shown to the players during the game alsoNodeContext: Loud, encouraging - but more eager to see your money.

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: On second thought, I'm done playing.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Commentator: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.
session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.text: Better be careful - those webs carry vibrations.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.
session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses.SlowDown: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed: After being let off the pane of the windmill.
session_synopses.AD_Plead: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Examine the meat. Perhaps there is some trick to removing the dagger.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger is tightly embedded in the carcass. You notice nothing unusual.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

AD_Goblin_00.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Goblin_00.text: Watch what you touch. If'n it smells like wee it's claimed, right?

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.context: NodeContext: search the place, don't bother me

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.text: And you got nothing to show for it but your own arse.

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

session_synopses.AD_Goblin_00: Goblin is standing in ruined cottage, fiercely protecting what meagre loot they've found.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You! Not a step closer.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: What happened to your friend?

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Wait.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Protect them.

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Edowin. Ed! Please!
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: He's with the Absolute now.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Why are you out here? The wilderness is dangerous.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: We know that all too well. But... the Absolute sent us here.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: We're looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_InspectCookingPot.speaker: Player
VB_InspectCookingPot.text: Reeks of mugwort. Tastes terrible, but makes some useful potions.

QuasitSummon.text: Bwahaha! Smell like steak. Yum. Yum.

QuasitSummon.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon.text: The truth now, wretch - or I'll gut you.
Good. Shovel likes having more holes.
Now. Truth. Balsam for wounds. Power is king. Always.

QuasitSummon.speaker: Player
QuasitSummon.text: What does that last part even mean?
Urgh. That new master is stupid.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_TrapStart.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_InspectCookingPot: The player examines a large pot in an abandoned house. They may or may not realise it was used for brewing potions, not cooking,
session_synopses.QuasitSummon: The quasit is a summon that has information about the Thayan cellar. She's alittle shithead who loves nothing more than cutting people up and being an arsehole.
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.VB_TrapStart: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: The bugbear shouts at the players after they barge in on the couple having sex.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

session_synopses.AD_MissingPoster: A faded poster of missing children in an abandoned village, indicating an earlier Dark Justiciar abduction.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: InternalNodeContext: Non-barbarian flowNodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: A final desperate cry (he's killed by the player immediately after this).

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: What've we got 'ere...? Oh.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's face falls mid-sentence when he realises he's being confronted by a drow.NodeContext: The goblin loses his bluster mid sentence upon realising he's facing a feared drow

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Stop this thiiiing!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome swings past on the sail of a spinning windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he rotates. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblin seems unsure whether to bow to you or attack.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Narration.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-what do you want, or, I mean... what do you need?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous, fumbling over his words. He's naturally afraid of drows such as the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the goblins.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-wha? Quick, get 'em!

session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Surrender_NotAtWindmill: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.
session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Selûne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
PAD_NoticeShrine.context: NodeContext: Shar worshipper: notices the Selune shrine and makes a disdainful comment. Selune worshippers: notices the shrine and reacts with reverence.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.context: NodeContext: Hushed awe. A good omen from their goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeShrine: The party comments on a little shrine they've discovered in a cavern - a grotto containing a statue and some prayers and offerings left by worshippers. Players may or may not recognise that the statue is the goddess Selûne. Shadowheart, as well as certain cleric/paladin tags, will recognise the statue always.
session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite: A Selûne-worshipping player manages to unseal a magically locked chest after reading a prayer.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
node_data.text: What do ya want? I'm not the one in charge.

session_synopses: A goblin raider, part of a patrol roaming the forest. Currently tormenting a deep gnome prisoner by tying him to a windmill. If the player gets too close, the goblin turns hostile - unless the player is a drow, in which case the goblin is servile.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player doesn't have Speak with Animals.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to pounce.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Study the owlbear's behaviour.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The owlbear's one good eye flicks away for a moment. You follow its glance...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The owlbear glances over

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *...and see an owlbear cub.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub is highlighted.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Back away slowly.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you retreat, the owlbear lets out a short huff. The message is clear...*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *...You can leave now, or step closer and die.*

PAD_KilledByGoblins.speaker: Player
PAD_KilledByGoblins.text: Looks like the goblins found her.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.PAD_KilledByGoblins: a Voicebark to make it more clear that a band of goblins came and killed the owlbear after the players have seen the owlbear but left the cave with her alive.
session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.
session_synopses.AD_Crack: SFX only. A tree trunk bridge across a ravine groans and creaks under the weight of the player as they walk across it. Two seconds after this sound is heard, it'll collapse entirely.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

session_synopses.ApproachedUnfortunateGnome: Rather than openly approaching the goblins/worgs near the windmill, a player snuck by and then gets spotted once they're near the windmill. Combat starts immediately.

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Well, well, boys. Looks like we got ourselves a trespasser.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Oi! You just walked into the wrong town.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at playerNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Wait - a drow? In the sun?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Taken aback - this is bad news for them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Stand down! This one's got a touch of the Absolute about them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Apologies, your lordship. Hard makin' you out from a distance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Don't let it happen again.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: O-of course. Come and go as you as you like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: BowsNodeContext: Fearful

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Move it, lads! And show some respect!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouting around to their comradesNodeContext: Shouting around to their comrades

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Mind the ogres, your drowsiness. They don't got no respect.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.
