session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Never thought I'd ever walk in on a bugbear and an ogre.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Everytime I close my eyes, I can see... it.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterFight: VB that plays after killing the bugbear and the ogre when we got attacked barging in on them having sex.Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 ended up fighting them.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.text: Gonna poke some extra holes in you!

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.
session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

AD_Summoned.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD_Summoned.text: Stuff your belly, brother - the feast's begun!

AD_Summoned.speaker: Chock
AD_Summoned.context: NodeContext: Calling aloud like a war cry!

session_synopses.AD: Three ogres have a meal time discussion. Chock and Fank are stupid. Lump is smart.
session_synopses.AD_Summoned: Ogres speak ADs when summoned into battle.They are hungry and ready to tear their targets apart

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Looking... for Her weapon... the Absolute...

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.
session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

AD_Mocking.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Mocking.context: NodeContext: Jeering/mocking, and a bit sing-song

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill. Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a gnome for sport.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of her chosen disciples.
False

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: I expect more than your word. Show me your flesh.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

session_synopses.PAD: The player realises that a crossbow found in Ketheric City is not Dueargar make. If they pass a history check, they recognise it as Sharran.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're free - go on.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Free. Yes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wavering.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: They're not even going after him. I wish I were surprised.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: I saw a body left by the myconids - your 'Gekh' must be dead.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What a load of rothé shite. No way a mushroom killed Gekh.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.
session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grab the sword with both hands and pull.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It feels like you're warring with ten people for the blade, but with another hard yank, the weapon slips free from the stone.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: character struggles with sword, but eventually pulls it out. what a feat of strength!

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

session_synopses.CINE_FromPLA: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using an elevator to get from the Zhentarim Hideout to the Underdark

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I greet you, friend of the dark.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body.*

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *A voice drifts into your mind as you gaze upon the misshapen servant.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: If you're so eager for blood, Glut, then let me give it to you.

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*it nourishes us all. the Circles, the drow - we drink of its essence*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.context: NodeContext: imply turning back with hand genstures but please keep it genralised.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Argh...I'm coming along. Just not fast enough. Any word on my people?
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: Gasping at ache. Frustrated she's not healing quicker.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome.text: Remind me - what do I need to do?

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Like I said, save my kin. And if you kill any duergar, you won't see tears from me.
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: Reiterating what she wants us to do. On the mend.

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *An object catches your eye - a lantern, it seems, though no light flickers within.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: | NEEDS CONTEXT |

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Examine the dust within the lantern.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *To all appearances, the dust seems quite ordinary.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: No need to show the dust if it is not visible. Camera can remain on player's face.

session_synopses: Player finds a broken Moonlantern while looting Nere's body. Companions reflect on it - either unsure what it is or discussing the fact that it's a Moonlantern, which would help them traverse a cursed land. If it wasn't broken.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Why were you in the Underdark?

Dead.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
Dead.text: Hunting... ingredients... noblestalk... with my love...

session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Focus on this entity. What are its intentions?

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Beneath the rampant joy, you sense the monk's fear and sincerity. He doesn't wish to harm you - but that doesn't mean he won't.*

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: Stand down. I'm not trying to take anything.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Empty words, jargh. Adamantine's precious, and I'm not the sharing type.

session_synopses.Guard_001_Dead: SwD with the Taskmaster in the Fearful Rothe situation. He might tell you about an ancient forge lying further inside Grymforge.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Did you come here with the duergar?

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue for True Soul Nere. He may tell you about the temple he was looking for as well as what is inside it.
session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach into one of the holes.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The passage narrows and bends, becoming impassable before you're even elbow-deep.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player has arm inside hole in wall, up to the elbow, frustrated

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

Saved.speaker: Skickpit
Saved.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

session_synopses.Saved: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is shouting at the gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Whispers. Moans. Disharmony. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then, you see visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping myconid remains with their axes.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*they broke our peace. they killed our young*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*we laid waste to many. you bring yet another. you bring us the Rot*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know the value of clan. Let me enter, so I may help yours.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the Rot festers. duergar remain. lakeward*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.
session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap

PAD_SharTempleVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharTempleVista.text: That almost looks like... no, it couldn't be, surely...
PAD_SharTempleVista.context: NodeContext: Awe/hesitation, as if doubting what she's seeing in the distance. Has not let the player know she is a shar worshipper.

session_synopses.PAD_SharTempleVista: Shadowheart notices the Shar Temple in the Underdark

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.text: Hardly the time for a repast. Later, maybe...
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Spoken to self. Lightly chastising herself for attempting to eat a mushroom at an inopportune moment.

session_synopses.PAD_RefuseNobleStalk: Shadowheart states that she doesn't want to eat the Noblestalk or is not ready for it yet.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.
session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The two rothé moan quietly as lights flash about their heads.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The two Rothé paw the ground in irritation as lights flash about their heads.*

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The rothé grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *One beast notices you and dulls his lights, ending the conversation.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Elder Rothe dulls his lights

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.RotheDiscussion: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The hole offers only pitch-black nothingness.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: HellooooOH!

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Extra-angry.This is the roar of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.
node_data.context:
NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

Clan-sen means a duergar from another clan. Pronounced like it is spelled.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: At least... at least some of us are safe, praise Ironhand.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: If only there were more blessings to count.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: If you're blowing the wall, now's the time.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: One of the gnomes who the duergar have enslaved. She's hard at work trying to free the True Soul trapped with the other gnomes. Her lover has fled the scene; player might share the news that the lover is dead, or has rejected her.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

AD_BOOOALAppears.speaker: BOOOAL
AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_BOOOALAppears: This line plays when we force a creature to reveal itself by overwhelming it with bloodlust
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard.speaker: Player
Wizard.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.text: *You heard its like described before - a memory shard, used to store brief mental impressions from the user's mind.*

session_synopses.Wizard: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.MemoryCrystal: This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn).The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted.speaker: Wyll
Looted.text: If their killer's still around, it's not Shar's name I'm most interested in saving.

session_synopses.Looted: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: If you cared so much, you'd have cured her already.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The circle's music slows. You recognise the melody as one of shame and mourning.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The myconids will raise her husk. Life born from death - as penance.*

session_synopses.InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder: Myconid responses to seeing Thulla - the injured gnome - being killed through the dialog.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Close the eye-thing for good, then spring Nere. Time we got what was coming to us.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've obtained explosive powder.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Good. Drop it near the rubble when it's time. Flaming arrow or some such'll set it off.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

session_synopses.PAD_IdolLooted: Party loots the Idol of Shar.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *It is exactly what it appears to be - a rather stained and unsavoury look at the mating rituals of the common flumph.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and studies the text before them

session_synopses.DisguisedJournal: This book is recovered from the body of Xargrim, a wizard searching for the Adamantine Forge. It contains instructions on how to operate the forge, but is disguised as a rather smutty "nature" textbook.Flumph = FLUMF.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse after casting a speak with dead spell on it

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue initiated when speaking to the decomposing corpse of a toll collector found in an abandoned tollhouse basement

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: Still warm to the touch, if you can believe it.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: A dragon is clearly not to be trifled with.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Come on, mragreshem! I'll take my chances against you than your friends on the bridge!
TieflingScout.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.text: I should have ended you when I had the chance.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.context: InternalNodeContext: She was never a companion

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: These gith are formidable - but not infallible. We can take them in battle, should it come to that.

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: Let's see if they want to have their blood spilled.

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: A githyanki slate. Give it here!

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.context: NodeContext: Tir'su: the githanki alphabet. Pronounced TEAR-soo.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate, then to Lae'zel. Your own body buzzes in resonance.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A diagram glows before you. Its meaning is beyond your comprehension.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: It is a map. A githyanki crèche lies within an ancient temple at the mountain pass.

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: Hurry forth. Purification is at hand.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.PAD_Shield: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_LaezelSidesWithGith: |Player manually attacked the githyanki, bypassing the normal flow. Lae'zel is still a NPC. She sides with the githyanki in this combat.|
session_synopses.AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.PartyReaction: Companions react to the gith chokepoint (dragon flew by and killed the flaming fists). Lae'zel is handled in a different dialog.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

FirstThanks.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FirstThanks.text: Come. I'm afraid proper thanks must wait.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fresh air, at last.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll rescue Duke Ravengard. You have my word.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll search for Duke Ravengard.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Go. You should pick up the drow trail with ease.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

session_synopses.FirstThanks: You speak with Desire after freeing her but before she reaches safety and engages the flaming fist
session_synopses: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Grand Duke Ravengard could be inside! Don't just stand there - push!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent and focused; slightly annoyed with PC.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Push against the wreckage.
True

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Inside, hurry! We don't have much time!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressing the whole groupNodeContext: Relieved and ready to move move move

AD_FoundDeadDesire.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis, Fist Recruit Ito, Fist Recruit Pavel, Gauntlet Yeva
AD_FoundDeadDesire.text: Florrick... we had better send her body home.

session_synopses: A group of Flaming Fists are trying to force a way into the burning inn at Waukeen's Rest. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be Grand Duke Ravengard, who they had been sent to protect.
session_synopses.AD_FoundDeadDesire: Reaction from the Flaming Fists if they run into a dead Councillor Florrick.

DeadFF1_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadFF1_Dead.text: Why were you at the inn?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Why were you at the inn?

Sign_PAD.speaker: Player
Sign_PAD.text:
'Welcome to Waukeen's Rest.
West - Baldur's Gate. East - Elturel.'
Sign_PAD.context: NodeContext: The player is reading from a signpost. Pronunciation: Wah-KEEN, ELL-tur-ELL

session_synopses.DeadFF1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.
session_synopses.DeadCiv1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.
session_synopses.OxAlive_AD: An ox caught in a stall near a burning inn. He is agitated, a dead goblin at  his feet. This AD plays if the player gets near but dialogue cannot be initiated (say, if they're polymorphed.)
session_synopses.DeadGoblin1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the goblin raiders. He was killed chasing a child through the inn.
session_synopses.Sign_PAD: The player is reading from a signpost in front of the tavern 'Waukeen's Rest'.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Agent_003_Dead.text: What were you carrying in the wagons?

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.text: I'm out of flasks! They're coming!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.context: NodeContext: terrified, shouting desperately during a battle - the 'flask' are like flammable grenades he was using to hold back monsters, and now he's run out they're coming for him

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: There must be another way out!

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: There is. Hurl yourself into the chasm back there.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Aye. It'd be quicker than having your guts torn out by them beasts.

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character is tied to chair.NodeContext: badly beaten, eyes closed, barely conscious, expecting to be killed

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.text: ... you beautiful bastard... thought my luck had finally run out...
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: either slumping in chair (no longer tied) or falling to knees, rubbing his wrists where he was boundNodeContext: exhausted and badly beaten - we just untied him from a chair where he was being tortured. Grateful and relieved but almost passing out from the pain

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.text: You can take the bloody chest.
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.context: NodeContext: firm, he wants nothing to do with this chest anymore

Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.text: Whatever's inside is probably cursed.  Brought us nothing but bad luck.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: By the gods, you're a sweet sight.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Are any of my crew still alive out there?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: This whole journey's been one grim sight after another. Gnolls, goblins... drow.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: sadly, with disgust and fear on the last word

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. You're the first friendly face we've seen since Elturgard.

Agent_001.speaker: Player
Agent_001.text: Elturgard's a long way from here. Where are you heading?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: We're bound for Baldur's Gate - got some cargo to deliver. But we've a stop to make along the way.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Waukeen's Rest. It's just up the road. I'd be enjoying a mug of ale right now if those beasts hadn't jumped us.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: Wau-KEEN's Rest is a tavern. Regretful

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Listen. You look like you know how to handle yourself.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: Pause before speaking as he looks us up and down, appraising us

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: You should meet my associates. We've got our own drinking spot by the tavern - invitation only.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: With a smile on 'invitation only'

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Tell the fellow on the door 'little serpent, long shadow'. He'll take good care of you.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: inviting us into his secret club

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Agent_001_TiedUp: In situations where Rugan survives after being beaten and tortured by the Zhentarim, players can interact with him in the chair he's tied to. He's exhausted, badly beaten, and barely capable of speaking full sentences.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest: Zhent agent reacts to player's interacting with the chest he was guarding. He's not interested in guarding it anymore, and is preparing to leave after losing his companions to monsters.
session_synopses.Agent_001: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.

session_synopses.AD_Detour: Sign before the Risen Road detour around SCL.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: These bones are ancient. I wonder who they were.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: There are Harper and druid symbols on their equipment - an interesting pair.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: I will make you new flesh.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
